[{'created': '2017-09-01 15:41:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix devstack gate hook for fullstack job

or we lack the tweak that makes sure that IPV4_ADDRS_SAFE_TO_USE is
set to a value that avoids conflicst in all cloud provider.

commit_message:
devstack gate hook for fullstack job, use devstack-gate-vm.sh

We need to call devstack-vm-gate.sh from the gate hook,
or we lack the tweak that makes sure that IPV4_ADDRS_SAFE_TO_USE is
set to a value that avoids conflicst in all cloud provider.

This change does what is needed so that we can use
devstack-vm-gate.sh .

Depends-On: I092ac244d67e31a2ca60c4bb83a88d477ef07b97
Depends-On: I09ce573ffa93b61d389547b733c0904774420352
Change-Id: Ib2a4f1f258d39dcba370fe37799c56ad0e5ca8fd
Closes-Bug: 1693689
Related-Bug: 1714289

commit_message:
Enable MySQL Cluster Support for neutron-vpnaas

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting from oslo.db
from bug 1564110.This allows operators to select from MySQL (InnoDB)
or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf
Change-Id: Id2f2b9af45a9f62351e83c9e62ca1f7bc6331513
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

commit_message:
Enable MySQL Cluster Support for midonet

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting from oslo.db
from bug 1564110.This allows operators to select from MySQL (InnoDB)
or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf
Change-Id: I69b7b1b716ef701666ef503c8fffc325ac23e221
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

commit_message:
functional tests: ignore all ODL tables

Because some ODL DB consistency checks fail [1], and our purpose is
not to run ODL these checks in this project.

http://logs.openstack.org/13/494213/7/check/legacy-networking-bgpvpn-dsvm-functional/70b8416/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-10-06_18_23_58_755159

Change-Id: I0148b577244b57ea54a58ca3ea00d10249a62d1e

commit_message:
Enable MySQL Cluster Support for neutron dynamic-routing

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting from oslo.db
from bug 1564110.This allows operators to select from MySQL (InnoDB)
or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf
Change-Id: I2ba66cc5108ef2b1523a01d64ac5de5a1ee528c3
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-23 18:26:38.000000000', 'message': 'Shrink Tempest scenario manager copy

scenario manager in tempest plugin was copied from
Tempest to avoid any plugin break.

This copied version of scenario manager is using lot of
Tempest interfaces. Many of them are not stable and might
change which can break plugin.

For example - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/503875/3

This commit shrinks the scenario manager copy to keep
only required methods.

Change-Id: I4b767c4622be0202ae3fca557dbedc57b1a717c5
'}]
commit_message:
Shrink Tempest scenario manager copy

scenario manager in tempest plugin was copied from
Tempest to avoid any plugin break.

This copied version of scenario manager is using lot of
Tempest interfaces. Many of them are not stable and might
change which can break plugin.

For example - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/503875/3

This commit shrinks the scenario manager copy to keep
only required methods.

Change-Id: I4b767c4622be0202ae3fca557dbedc57b1a717c5

commit_message:
Enable MySQL Cluster Support for neutron networking_sfc

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting from oslo.db
from bug 1564110.This allows operators to select from MySQL (InnoDB)
or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf
Change-Id: Ia5de8b6d0ad4c55fff9692b59b30baf3e2b83d4a
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

commit_message:
use API_PREFIX from BGPVPN API definition

It is better to use this cleanly defined
API_PREFIX rather than a hardcoded string or
"/" + api_def.ALIAS.

Change-Id: I2038a374d97dadb5d53677e65616903b6b62a707

Use 'flow_classifier' and 'sfc' API ext definition from neutron_lib

Use the API definition from neutron-lib for 'flow_classifier'
and 'sfc' API extensions.

[{'created': '2018-06-20 23:43:07.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: FloatingIP create throws an error if no l3 agent

FloatingIP create throws an error if the L3 agent is not running
on the given host for DVR Routers.
This happens when we try to create a DVR Router in the Legacy
Router deployed cloud.
FloatingIP create checks for the agent type based on the host,
and when agents are not available on the given host, it raises
an exception.
This patch will fixes by handling the exception raised, when the
agent is not available.

commit_message:
DVR: FloatingIP create throws an error if no l3 agent

FloatingIP create throws an error if the L3 agent is not running
on the given host for DVR Routers.
This happens when we try to create a DVR Router in the Legacy
Router deployed cloud.
FloatingIP create checks for the agent type based on the host,
and when agents are not available on the given host, it raises
an exception.
This patch will fixes by handling the exception raised, when the
agent is not available.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py

Change-Id: I80522d12087495861e832cf1c7a3fe9a7830d386
Closes-Bug: #1776566
(cherry picked from commit 5ceca4d9d1041345ccfeab675c8e8216050f7135)

commit_message:
Add initialization in StringMatchingFilterObj class

In order to support LIKE statement filter in OVO objects,
StringMatchingFilterObj class is introduced. However, this class
does not provide initial attributes of "starts", "contains" and
"ends".

In real usage, if these attributes are not initialized, we will
hit failures in method apply_filters() in db/_model_query.py.

This patch adds the initialization back.

Secondly, a typo of "obj_utils.StringMatchingContains" is revised
in this patch too.

Change-Id: If828068d8d08ff09dff6c63d53320bc397d32448
Closes-Bug: #1724446
(cherry picked from commit 28e8265651da2aad1d253f3a47c0e71525dd5e1b)

commit_message:
Enable the use of advanced images in tempest tests

This patch enables the use of Ubuntu guest as advanced image for
those tests requiring it. In particular, we're interested in running
the trunk scenario tests with it.

Depends-On: I0450fe2ab08bc103b1848bf9018468c1a8dc94e4
Change-Id: Ia2c5b85beaa021d6bad0dbdef30a09c63ec4343c

commit_message:
Support vlan transparent network for ml2 ovs driver

Now, ovs was supports QinQ, this patch can support vlan
transparent for openvswitch Ml2 driver, when tenant create
network which has 'vlan transprent' property.

This patch uses the already existing property 'vlan_transparent'
of network to indicates that corresponding ovs port needs to be
configure to QinQ mode.

In vxlan mode, we also modify the unicast table and learnt
table, to avoid all vlan tags be stripped.

Closes-bug: #1604222

Change-Id: Id1ac60795bbc793ba0777e6a096177d6c1725ad6

Two things:
- in the new tab ("BGPVPNs" tab in the view of a Network), the action button for an association does not propose to delete the action
- in the new tab ("BGPVPNs" tab in the view of a Network), the action button still shows "update router associations" and "update network associations" which is, as we had discussed, not relevant (we are in the context of a single network, why propose interactions about other networks ?)

Also, the same view would be nice to have for a router.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 07:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

- The button delete (and create) is in the admin panel. Maybe you was in the project part?
- Yes the buttons "update router associations" and "update network associations" will be remove in a different patch once 536899 and 553444 will be merged.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-05 08:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> - The button delete (and create) is in the admin panel. Maybe you
 > was in the project part?

You have in mind the "delete BGPVPN" button, but I'm talking about deleting an association.

In the Network panel (for both project an admin), under the BGPVPN tab, on the line for an associatied BGPVPN, we lack a way to delete the association (and to edit the association)


 > - Yes the buttons "update router associations" and "update network
 > associations" will be remove in a different patch once 536899 and
 > 553444 will be merged.

This is not really my point. Even with these two choices removed, we still will have a dropdown list of choices some of which not relevant in the context that the user has chose (for instance, we will propose interactions with router associations while the user has chosen to focus on Networks).'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> You have in mind the "delete BGPVPN" button, but I'm talking about
 > deleting an association.

Ok. In my mind to delete a association, the user must clic on the bgpvpn to access of the detail of the bgpvpn and the tab network associations and router associations'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

> > You have in mind the "delete BGPVPN" button, but I'm talking
 > about
 > > deleting an association.
 > 
 > Ok. In my mind to delete a association, the user must clic on the
 > bgpvpn to access of the detail of the bgpvpn and the tab network
 > associations and router associations

This remains a valid way, but since the network association relates to both the BGPVPN and the network it is convenient to be able to see it *and* act on it from both paths.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:46:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I'm realizing a few things (sorry to not have realized earlier...):
- we miss a "create network association" in the "network associations" tab (above the list of associations)
- and, in the table:
  * the "name" column should be titled "BGPVPN name"
  * the "update BGPVPN" row action is not so useful, since editing a 
    BGPVPN is naturally done via the "BGPVPN Interconnections" panel
  * an "update association" would be more useful (this applies to the
    router BGPVPN tab, in change Id5672ff1e276c726a2cbce1cb9d02f164f95622d,
    in fact, not for network BGPVPN tab)

[{'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-04-05 03:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-04-05 03:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-04-20 02:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-04-20 02:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-05-10 11:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi, need your kind suggestion for vpn qos. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-06-15 03:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27488, 'date': '2018-09-27 16:41:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I have tried this patch. And I get this error: 

```
DBReferenceError: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1452, u'Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`neutron`.`qos_vpnservice_policy_bindings`, CONSTRAINT `qos_vpnservice_policy_bindings_ibfk_2` FOREIGN KEY (`qos_policy_id`) REFERENCES `qos_policies` (`i
d`) ON DELETE CASCADE)') [SQL: u'INSERT INTO qos_vpnservice_policy_bindings (qos_policy_id, vpn_service_id) VALUES (%(qos_policy_id)s, %(vpn_service_id)s)'] [parameters: {'vpn_service_id': 'bcfd2d4a-f750-4257-b12d-d86479d09fe2', 'qos_policy_id': 'qos_policy_id'}]
```

I think we should use binding_id for new table instead of constraints"}, {'account_id': 27488, 'date': '2018-10-01 03:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27488, 'date': '2018-10-01 08:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-03 07:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-10-03 07:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-12-25 10:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Sorry for late, I will pick this up again. Thanks for comments.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:54:28.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
Introduce decorators for the SBI revision system

This patch implements the decorators around the API for the SBI revision
system, as defined by the neutron spec [1].

[1]:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/sbi-database-consistency

Change-Id: I053bb3b1732de49bb881f8726cd7b991bd63399f
Implements: blueprint sbi-database-consistency

commit_message:
Introduce contexts for the SBI revision system

This patch implements the decorators around the API for the SBI revision
system, as defined by the neutron spec [1].

[1]:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/sbi-database-consistency

Change-Id: Ie2175ba68362eef65f9e87f9899f305415bc2f65
Implements: blueprint sbi-database-consistency

subject: Add maintenance utility functions for the SBI revision system

commit_message:
Make OVS the default option for L2 FWaaS V2

Currenlty our default is noop but with Stein we feel confident that OVS
works and want to enable it by default. As a result one of the tests
needed to be changed and a firewall group applied to the VM port.

Change-Id: If827e5fd951b55d550bb9fcade2647ebcb76b553

commit_message:
port legacy jobs to zuul v3

This patch adds the legacy functional jobs to the project by porting
their legacy playbooks to in-repo playbooks and updating the zuul
config.

Change-Id: Iaae804c89c3069e98f383371c8a332ff8ec8cb8c
Related-Bug: 1816644

commit_message:
Add 'snat' as a new resource type for logging in OSC plugin

Currently, OSC plugin for logging only supports 'security_group'
and 'firewall_group' as a resource type for logging. This patch
aims to add 'snat' as a new supported resource type to OSC.

Change-Id: I0f3d478fcce6b9ada1c85a13115042ac4634b59b
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Partial-Bug: #1752290
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612612/

commit_message:
agent: use psutil to avoid shell out to a find a child process

This method is being called regularly (once a second) and
goes through a fork/close_fds/exec loop just to call /bin/ps
in order to find the list of child pids. We can have that easier
avoiding all the subprocess overhead by using psutil.

in a cProfile micro-benchmark, it seems using psutil is
also about 30% faster. As there were only two usages
of the function and it had a fairly awkward interface, expecting
pids as string and returned a list of strings, removing the
function and replacing it with direct psutil counterparts
improved code readability as well.

Change-Id: Ic9a270634c8568676f7cb8322676a79605334516

commit_message:
WIP Add fullstack memory leak test for L2 agents

This patch is PoC of some fullstack test which can check if we don't
have memory leaks in neutron-{ovs,linuxbridge}-agents.

It isn't ready yet. Please just tell me what You think about such
possible solution. Does it makes any sense for You?

Change-Id: Ida0e50de9e423f686373df4eb14a45bbe252a706

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 04:36:31.000000000', 'message': "Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: If42157006464d0a1eef7ea994f57b8c93a2dd62d
"}]
commit_message:
Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: If42157006464d0a1eef7ea994f57b8c93a2dd62d

commit_message:
use SqlFixture from neutron-lib

Use neutron-lib's StaticSqlFixture rather than creating a new fixture
extending neutron's StaticSqlFixture as the later should not be needed.

Change-Id: I6fd224d9ba1a5f18ebb22094a07ad7a474a673ac

commit_message:
DNM: test gate

DO NOT MERGE

This patch contains a no-op change just to trigger the gate for
testing purposes to better help understand why the periodic job
with neutron-lib is failing like [1].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
networking-midonet/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/

[{'created': '2019-05-01 16:15:58.000000000', 'message': 'dvr: preserve orginal routing for existing connections on FIP association

in DVR routers, after floating ip association to a guest, the routing of
connections is drastically changed, and existing connections starve and
die.
This change adds a mechanism to preserve the original routing for those
existing connection only, right before adding the floating IP
- mark the existing connections
- copy the mark to packets
- add exception to policy routing, to use the same old route for the old
connections

Change-Id: I2f4cda75a986f3367f8d5596d63f3b2ea0f433ea
Closes-Bug: #1818824
'}]
commit_message:
dvr: preserve orginal routing for existing connections on FIP association

in DVR routers, after floating ip association to a guest, the routing of
connections is drastically changed, and existing connections starve and
die.
This change adds a mechanism to preserve the original routing for those
existing connection only, right before adding the floating IP
- mark the existing connections
- copy the mark to packets
- add exception to policy routing, to use the same old route for the old
connections

Change-Id: I2f4cda75a986f3367f8d5596d63f3b2ea0f433ea
Closes-Bug: #1818824

There are some extreme conditions which will result the unbound
router gateway port. Then all the centralized floating IPs will
not be reachable since the gateway port was set to 4095 tag.

This patch adds the HA status to the router related port
processing code path. If it is HA router, the gateway port
will go to the right HA router processing code branch.

Closes-Bug: #1827754
Change-Id: Ida1c9f3a38171ea82adc2f11cb17945d6e2434be
(cherry picked from commit 3d99147e732ab4cdad0b8243e5fabb6a8954aa72)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dvr ha router gateway port binding host

There are some extreme conditions which will result the unbound
router gateway port. Then all the centralized floating IPs will
not be reachable since the gateway port was set to 4095 tag.

This patch adds the HA status to the router related port
processing code path. If it is HA router, the gateway port
will go to the right HA router processing code branch.

Closes-Bug: #1827754
Change-Id: Ida1c9f3a38171ea82adc2f11cb17945d6e2434be
(cherry picked from commit 3d99147e732ab4cdad0b8243e5fabb6a8954aa72)

[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-03 14:57:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-05-04 14:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(16 comments)

Some corrections, a few notes from what we discussed in the PTG, and a few opinions.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-05-06 22:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-05-16 14:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

Thanks for writing this up.

The bitterest pill seems to be the need for API v3 in order to introduce versioned extensions. We need to find a good solution with or without v3.

One part I was missing is the description of how to interpret verions numbers. I guess it'd be a 2-component semantic version, but it never hurts to be explicit with things like that.

Another thing I suggest is to write a devref quite early that leads the hand of developers wanting to version their extensions. With nice examples: When to introduce a new extension. When to bump a minor version. When to bump a major version. When to use experimental versions. When to jump to 1.0. Stuff like that."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-05-16 20:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:51:46.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This patch adds support for using oslo.privsep when using NS_WRAPPER
in order to speed up the processes and not content resources with
the neutron-rootwrap-daemon as the status checks can take a considerable
amount of time.

'}, {'created': '2018-10-17 11:21:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for oslo.privsep for NS_WRAPPER execution

This patch adds support for using oslo.privsep when using NS_WRAPPER
in order to speed up the processes and not content resources with
the neutron-rootwrap-daemon as the status checks can take a considerable

commit_message:
Add support for oslo.privsep for NS_WRAPPER execution

This patch adds support for using oslo.privsep when using NS_WRAPPER
in order to speed up the processes and not content resources with
the neutron-rootwrap-daemon as the status checks can take a considerable
amount of time.

Change-Id: I1ac9e59d949695ffdfdb5c4488cf5b4ffbc2107b

commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7

[{'account_id': 28561, 'date': '2018-06-29 09:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-29 09:33:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-06-29 13:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Nikos for working on that.

A few comments:
- RDs are optional in the API, so rather than modify existing tests and add RDs, it would be better to add new tests
- the ref implementation does not support specifying RDs, for the test addition to pass CI, we will need to disable this test for the reference implementation, which is ok (need to change the regex in [1]
- a contribution to the reference driver will be needed so that the ref driver covers all the API, but this can be handled separately

I will comment a bit more on the launchpad bug 17784880 on why specifying RDs in the API is optional.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/devstack/devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc#L7'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 09:33:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add Route Distinguishers parameter in tempest scenario tests

The scenario test cases under networking_bgpvpn_tempest don't supply
route_distinguishers parameter when creating a BGP VPN and as a result
there is no reach (ping) from a VM in one associated network to
a VM in another associated network.
A method to generate route_distinguishers is introduced and the
parameteris provided in all test cases. In "Test port association
routes of type 'bgpvpn'" case, different RD parameters are used in each
L3 VPN created.

Closes-Bug: #1778480

Change-Id: Iee66d2f9c239b7df7fbdefb149e6d140b9a47ff6
Signed-off-by: nikoskarandreas <nick@intracom-telecom.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add Route Distinguishers parameter in tempest scenario tests

The scenario test cases under networking_bgpvpn_tempest don't supply
route_distinguishers parameter when creating a BGP VPN and as a result
there is no reach (ping) from a VM in one associated network to
a VM in another associated network.
A method to generate route_distinguishers is introduced and the
parameteris provided in all test cases. In "Test port association
routes of type 'bgpvpn'" case, different RD parameters are used in each
L3 VPN created.

Closes-Bug: #1778480

Change-Id: Iee66d2f9c239b7df7fbdefb149e6d140b9a47ff6
Signed-off-by: nikoskarandreas <nick@intracom-telecom.com>

commit_message:
Adds remote firewall group to plugin

This add the remote fwg to the plugin. Follow
up patches will add it to agent/driver.

Change-Id: I05ea09217e4ce019cba5f357f35e17cc8d2e59d9
Depends-On:   I4086278fe90ec68631ae1dbba4b17f8cf06005ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 08:12:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add spec for SBI database consistency

In a common Neutron deployment model there could have multiple Neutron
API workers processing requests. For each request, the neutron worker
will update the Neutron database and then invoke the SBI to translate

This spec provides a solution that will give neutron an interface that
drivers that interact with SBIs can use to ensure that resources are
consistently pushed to the SBI.

Change-Id: Ic00cff898b7d6533f8017c824b293ea449c3dcdf
'}, {'created': '2018-05-02 12:55:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add spec for SBI database consistency

commit_message:
Add spec for SBI database consistency

In a common Neutron deployment model there could have multiple Neutron
API workers processing requests. For each request, the neutron worker
will update the Neutron database and then invoke the SBI to translate

This spec provides a solution that will give neutron an interface that
drivers that interact with SBIs can use to ensure that resources are
consistently pushed to the SBI.

Change-Id: Ic00cff898b7d6533f8017c824b293ea449c3dcdf

commit_message:
Add region name to fetch PTR records with designate

This change adds a new `region_name` field to the designate driver for
neutron to fetch PTR records.

Change-Id: Ib4fbd70a80dd37b250c5b2ec549fbb649e11e9d5

commit_message:
[WIP] Simplify some flow tables about openvswitch firewall driver

Currently, the ovs flow tables will become enormous if we use
openvswitch firewall driver. The patch try to simplify flow tables.

Change-Id: I353ce8b3ee4a2fe263f402c6969b6b29c69d1195
Related-Bug: #1831706

In order to better debug slow database interactions, enable the pulling
of the MySQL query log results into the job results file.  This is not
intended to merge, just be a diagnostic tool.

Change-Id: I549cdbf3d9a7b43327887c5b6416206b3571c26e

commit_message:
[DNM] Try pulling MySQL query logs in Zuul reports

In order to better debug slow database interactions, enable the pulling
of the MySQL query log results into the job results file.  This is not
intended to merge, just be a diagnostic tool.

Change-Id: I549cdbf3d9a7b43327887c5b6416206b3571c26e

Allowing to set the syslog facility will enable log filtering directly
at syslog level. This will in turn allows to get a proper, clean file

It defaults to "local0" for backward compatibility

'}]
commit_message:
WIP Allow to set haproxy log facility

Allowing to set the syslog facility will enable log filtering directly
at syslog level. This will in turn allows to get a proper, clean file
for all the HAProxy accesses done.

It defaults to "local0" for backward compatibility

Change-Id: Ibc7d4a0c26248e4db8f124c905e1b90b1fa652f2

This parameter applies to the OVSDB Controller table when the
native openflow driver is used. There are reports that increasing

commit_message:
Make OVS controller inactivity_probe configurable

This parameter applies to the OVSDB Controller table when the
native openflow driver is used. There are reports that increasing
it can reduce errors on busy systems. This patch also sets the
default value to 10s which is more than the OVS default of 5s.
See the ovs-vswitchd.conf.db man page for full description.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py
    neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: If0d42919412dac75deb4d7f484c42cea630fbc59

commit_message:
Neutron doesn't check that the gateway_ip

neutron doesn't check the validity of gateway_ip as a subnet had
been created. When we attach interface into a router for this
subnet, the neutron-server will report error.
So, we should check gateway_ip when creating a subnet.

Change-Id: I8dd0709a9c23b21374d5bf987f4ec03d381f435f
Closes-bug: 1835344

[{'created': '2019-06-26 06:49:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add a random initial_delay when agent starts

When managing bigger infrastructure, we may restart the neutron agents
from one place and all together.
As a result, the agents are reporting to neutron server at the same
time, which can lead to some load on server side.
By adding a random delay before reporting the first time, it will allow
the neutron server to swallow that load more easily.

commit_message:
Add a random initial_delay when agent starts

When managing bigger infrastructure, we may restart the neutron agents
from one place and all together.
As a result, the agents are reporting to neutron server at the same
time, which can lead to some load on server side.
By adding a random delay before reporting the first time, it will allow
the neutron server to swallow that load more easily.

Change-Id: I125eafeeeb85d7e1cf9025036c597c8043d7674c
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@gmail.com>

I'd think twice before stating this is going off the right direction, but there's too many questions to answer before I can formulate my opinion :)"}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2016-06-01 12:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I think that before introducing such an API, in particular with the intent that it became applicable to other APIs, the topic should be brought up on openstack-dev.

There is a high risk that its existence may feed the belief that "well, its ok if my controller does not support feature X because capabilities are exposed", and sustain heterogeneousness rather than fight it.

At the very least, if we go down this path, we should restrict the use of capabilities for things for which we known that the heterogenousness of support cannot be resolved (the example of SR-IOV vifs not compatible with ingress bw limitation comes to mind).

There is also a dimension of benefit/cost ratio, that for such a framework is not obviously favorable in my view (more on this in an inline comment).

FYI, in networking-bgpvpn the current status is:
- no capability discovery
- encourage all backends to support everything (a backend not supporting something should be considered a driver/backend limitation)
- at resource creation time, if what is requested by the API user can't be achieved with the driver, report an error so that the user does not spend time finding out whether the issue is a bug or a known driver limitation'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2016-06-01 12:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

this takes things down a very dangerous path. While it is true that there are going to be differences between back ends (in any system) that can't be fully glossed over, the entire purpose of the OpenStack APIs should be to abstract that as much as possible, and be very limitted in where you expose features.

Capabilities should definitely not be so numerous and undefined that they need UUIDs. They should be very strongly centrally defined in code as constants. 

There should also be a strong intent on making a capability an intent. For instance, on the Nova side we've been holding off supporting live-resize because we know that deployments will turn it off (as it breaks efficient scheduling).

If every client needs to write a giant set of conditionals around the capabilities, then having a REST API in the first place didn't save you much, and you were probably better off just talking to the vendor back ends directly outside of Neutron. Which is not really a thing I think any of us want."}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2016-06-01 13:03:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> this takes things down a very dangerous path. While it is true that
 > there are going to be differences between back ends (in any system)
 > that can't be fully glossed over, the entire purpose of the
 > OpenStack APIs should be to abstract that as much as possible, and
 > be very limitted in where you expose features.
 > 
 > Capabilities should definitely not be so numerous and undefined
 > that they need UUIDs. They should be very strongly centrally
 > defined in code as constants.
 > 
 > There should also be a strong intent on making a capability an
 > intent. For instance, on the Nova side we've been holding off
 > supporting live-resize because we know that deployments will turn
 > it off (as it breaks efficient scheduling).
 > 
 > If every client needs to write a giant set of conditionals around
 > the capabilities, then having a REST API in the first place didn't
 > save you much, and you were probably better off just talking to the
 > vendor back ends directly outside of Neutron. Which is not really a
 > thing I think any of us want.

+1"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2016-06-01 14:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I strongly agree with Sean and Thomas.

To me this appears to be a way to allow drivers to expose new things that are not supported by any others. So it's a way to expand the API. What I would expect instead would be a way to filter the current API and expose to users the actions that will work. The current proposal would work for that, but the difference in intent may shape the proposal into something else."}, {'account_id': 9396, 'date': '2016-06-01 15:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7776, 'date': '2016-06-02 02:27:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree that UUIDs aren't necessary. These aren't user created resources. These capabilities are derived directly from the driver(s) in use. I see that a documentation change has been submitted https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324048/ with approximately the same goal, i.e. to allow users to figure out what capabilities are available in light of the inevitable differences in what different backends can do.
This change originated from a discussion at the summit of how to handle the introduction of new API features that wouldn't (initially or perhaps long term) be supported by all drivers.
I view this API as having two benefits:
1) Allow client applications to fail fast by discovering that the cloud they're being executed against can't support their needs before they get started creating resources and need to roll back and delete.
2) Allow UIs (including Horizon and VNF managers and other custom created UIs) to selectively disable options associated with features that can't be supported

An SFC specific example of #2 would be allowing the UI to grey out a checkbox for symmetric service chain if the current backend doesn't support symmetric chains. The alternative would be presenting a checkbox to the user which, when checked, causes the chain creation to fail 100% of the time in a cloud where symmetric chains aren't possible."}, {'account_id': 11313, 'date': '2016-07-16 17:51:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11907, 'date': '2016-08-18 18:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9396, 'date': '2017-03-22 11:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9396, 'date': '2017-10-19 13:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Igor Duarte Cardoso with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Igor Duarte Cardoso <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

commit_message:
tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHTimeout sandbox debug

I'm creating this patch as my first one to join in the fight against
the random tempest scenario test failures related to SSHTimeouts that
I've been seeing at least since February.
It seems to me that some patches are more likely to get hit than others
and consequently I'm making this commit an exact copy of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/625134/23, which seems to be on the
more-likely side of the equation.

Change-Id: I49d3853cb7a1886e5e376d7c1fe7f4c734c9ed9e
Related-Bug: #1821912

On concurrent router interface creation DB retries are usual.
In case of DVR there are 2 sources for retries: csnat and dvr
router ports creation.
This patch wraps dvr port creation with retry to avoid duplicate router
subnet violation when retrying the main add_router_interface().
See bug for details.

Change-Id: Ia3c6429a82a9c349eb9577bf255d34f16c6d602e

(cherry picked from commit 314a06359e4eaa7a858f2ba88c98b0a849376aba)

commit_message:
Make dvr router port creation retriable

On concurrent router interface creation DB retries are usual.
In case of DVR there are 2 sources for retries: csnat and dvr
router ports creation.
This patch wraps dvr port creation with retry to avoid duplicate router
subnet violation when retrying the main add_router_interface().
See bug for details.

Change-Id: Ia3c6429a82a9c349eb9577bf255d34f16c6d602e
Closes-Bug: #1783728
(cherry picked from commit 314a06359e4eaa7a858f2ba88c98b0a849376aba)

commit_message:
Avoid auto-allocated gateway_ip when creating subnet with subnetpool

Creating a subnet with subnetpool, neutron will auto-allocate a gateway
ip to it. Therefore, we couldn't specify or remove gateway ip when
creating a subnet.

Change-Id: Ia553933b183829e2d682ec2e8c2a76b34931a67c
Closes-bug: 1716721

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 08:14:36.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Add trace info to ovo rpc push api

Despite previous efforts L2 agents today are not properly integrated
with osprofiler - for example ovs agent does not report trace points
at all. The architecture of osprofiler requires the propagation of trace
info on the side of the usual control channels. For L2 agents that means
RPC messages and change events in the softswitches (for example via
ovsdb-client --monitor), most importantly detection of the vif plug
done by nova/os-vif.

Enabling tracing by the vif plug was never done. In the original
integration of osprofiler some code was added to trigger tracing by RPC
messages. However I suspect that became defunct when the legacy RPC
notifications were replaced by OVO RPC push notifications.

This change propagates trace info into threads started by
futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor and by that trace info is added to RPC push
messages on the wire.

TODO I mostly do my manual testing by triggering a remote call to
port_delete(). That can be easily reproduced by starting a VM and
deleting its port while the VM is still running. The tracing mostly
works but once in every few traces the trace does not include trace
points from neutron-ovs-agent/port_delete() because the profiler is
initialized with the wrong base_id. I still need to debug why that
happens.

Change-Id: Ic81147220d08c6113ba62cf89915656ce93d0cdd
Partial-Bug: #1833674
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/273951
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/388939

commit_message:
WIP Add trace info to ovo rpc push api

Despite previous efforts L2 agents today are not properly integrated
with osprofiler - for example ovs agent does not report trace points
at all. The architecture of osprofiler requires the propagation of trace
info on the side of the usual control channels. For L2 agents that means
RPC messages and change events in the softswitches (for example via
ovsdb-client --monitor), most importantly detection of the vif plug
done by nova/os-vif.

Enabling tracing by the vif plug was never done. In the original
integration of osprofiler some code was added to trigger tracing by RPC
messages. However I suspect that became defunct when the legacy RPC
notifications were replaced by OVO RPC push notifications.

This change propagates trace info into threads started by
futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor and by that trace info is added to RPC push
messages on the wire.

TODO I mostly do my manual testing by triggering a remote call to
port_delete(). That can be easily reproduced by starting a VM and
deleting its port while the VM is still running. The tracing mostly
works but once in every few traces the trace does not include trace
points from neutron-ovs-agent/port_delete() because the profiler is
initialized with the wrong base_id. I still need to debug why that
happens.

Change-Id: Ic81147220d08c6113ba62cf89915656ce93d0cdd
Partial-Bug: #1833674
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/273951
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/388939
Related-Chahge: https://review.opendev.org/555608

commit_message:
Bump OVS req to 2.11 and cleanup extra checks

This patch is cleaning up some checks made for backwards
compat with old OVN schemas, in particular with < 2.8.2.

For some reason, upper-requirements reflects 2.11 but our
repo didn't honor that change so this patch is fixing the
requirements file in our own repo.

TODO: At some point we'll need to remove the backwards compat
and migration path from Address Sets to Port Groups for
the Neutron Security Groups implementation.

Change-Id: I399832b865d117aa5b1594dd47516d986fa8441f
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
use standard_attr db from neutron-lib

This patch consumes the neutron_lib.db.standard_attr module from
neutron-lib by switching all imports to use neutron-lib's standard_attr.

Change-Id: I4f5cbf3646fb7b9009946f82c0d49bd37da04ac9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 02:06:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add SR-IOV ML2 driver support for VLAN trunking.

Add VLAN trunking support for SR-IOV VFs based on Intel i40e NIC
driver.

The current SRIOV driver for trunking is based on Intel i40e NIC
driver with following requirements:-

hardware: Intel Ethernet Network Adapter XXV710 (25GbE)
Driver: Intel i40e v2.7.12 onwards

Closes-Bug: 1794771

Change-Id: I9f679e109290c3f6955dd63227d802355ee71d2d
Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add SR-IOV ML2 driver support for VLAN trunking.

Add VLAN trunking support for SR-IOV VFs based on Intel i40e NIC
driver.

The current SRIOV driver for trunking is based on Intel i40e NIC
driver with following requirements:-

hardware: Intel Ethernet Network Adapter XXV710 (25GbE)
Driver: Intel i40e v2.7.12 onwards

Closes-Bug: 1794771

Change-Id: I9f679e109290c3f6955dd63227d802355ee71d2d
Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>

commit_message:
remove trailing comma

when router is aimed to be disabled, extra-dhcp-options is given a
blank value, but it looks like there is a trailing comma at the end
of opt:router which causes dnsmasq adding its own ip address.

Change-Id: I3a081f2a349d77bbd30f07ea23d047a6487ef5d2

for TRUNK and SUBPORTS events.

commit_message:
use standard_attr db from neutron-lib

This patch consumes the neutron_lib.db.standard_attr module from
neutron-lib by removing the module and unit tests from neutron and
switching all imports to use neutron-lib's standard_attr.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ib50ec4d472ce500fc5cab2789ac77070733ce101

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-29 20:52:36.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test out how badly not embedding trunk details is

When you have a large number of trunk ports, then listing ports
is getting extremely slow (as for every trunk port a sub get_ports
for all the subports is being performed, hitting the database again).
It is easily possible to get queries then into the minute ranges,
which causes an issue with everything else tripping over.

Test out how far we get with not resolving the trunk port details
on listing (only on get_ports)

Change-Id: I3dca290861d631dcb25036392f0df17d048c2d4a
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Test out how badly not embedding trunk details is

When you have a large number of trunk ports, then listing ports
is getting extremely slow (as for every trunk port a sub get_ports
for all the subports is being performed, hitting the database again).
It is easily possible to get queries then into the minute ranges,
which causes an issue with everything else tripping over.

Test out how far we get with not resolving the trunk port details
on listing (only on get_ports)

Change-Id: I3dca290861d631dcb25036392f0df17d048c2d4a

In general, can we please fix the below method as given as part of this review :

def was_periodic_task_executed_recently(session, task, interval):
    now = session.execute(func.now()).scalar()
    delta = datetime.timedelta(seconds=interval)
    row = session.query(models.OpenDaylightPeriodicTask).filter(
        models.OpenDaylightPeriodicTask.task == task).one_or_none()
     
    if (row is None)
       LOG.info(“Row is absent for task %s, returning False”, task)
       return bool(False)

     result = bool(not (now - delta >= (row.lock_updated)))
     LOG.info(“task %s, now %s, delta %s, lock_updated %s bool %s”, task, now, delta, row.lock_updated, result)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 12:03:07.000000000', 'message': 'Hostconfig task is stuck in Processing state

When one of the processes failed during the hostconfig
periodic task execution the task will stay in this
state forever. As a result subsequent processes will
not be able to fetch the hostconfig information anymore.

The fix is to  reset the hostconfig task back to pending
once a threshold time interval is crossed for its
execution.

Closes-Bug: 1813047

Change-Id: Id1f4dc7e2248450821344d77de9ed9f2675ad836
Signed-off-by: Achuth <achuth.m@altencalsoftlabs.com>

When one of the processes failed during the hostconfig
periodic task execution the task will stay in this
state forever and as a result subsequent processes will
not be able to fetch the hostconfig information anymore,
assuming the previous process is still processing the
task.

The fix is to  reset the hostconfig task back to pending
once a threshold time interval has elapsed for its

commit_message:
Hostconfig task is stuck in Processing state

When one of the processes failed during the hostconfig
periodic task execution the task will stay in this
state forever and as a result subsequent processes will
not be able to fetch the hostconfig information anymore,
assuming the previous process is still processing the
task.

The fix is to  reset the hostconfig task back to pending
once a threshold time interval has elapsed for its
execution.

Closes-Bug: 1813047

Change-Id: Id1f4dc7e2248450821344d77de9ed9f2675ad836
Signed-off-by: Achuth <achuth.m@altencalsoftlabs.com>

commit_message:
Use new project templates the Zuul project definition

There are new project templates that were introduced with the dependent
patches. This allow the simplification of the project definition even
further.

This patch uses those project templates and removes the now unneeded
anchor required_projects_neutron.

Change-Id: Ic6efe859fca0dc832f1c2c3d1211be658ecdb78a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598103
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598104

commit_message:
Cleanup Zuul project definition

There is a lot of repetition of blocks that could benefit from YAML
anchors and references. Also, there is job specific directives that
make more sense to be present in the Zuul jobs definitions instead
of here.

This patch makes use of YAML anchors and references and moves the
job directives to the "right" place.

Change-Id: I418ac0ac02f7b97c4390748c997d7cac44cab0d2

commit_message:
Move the REST client URL builder methods to itself

Currently the methods are separate from the client disaggregating
functionality in different components. This increases difficulty to
maintain the code and is less universal.

This patch moves the code into the client and adds missing tests.

commit_message:
CLI/API Driver & Agent Support for Non-Transparent

   * Add 'exclusive' attribute in port_pair_group_parameters, which
     can be set to True to identify non-transparent service function.
     Default value of attribute is False.
   * Create CLI, API support for Non-Transparent Service Functions
   * Create Driver and Agent suuport for NonTransparent
   * Implement unit test cases for Non-Transparent

Implements: Non-Transparent
Dependent-Id: Ie95f296bd777e8c636bcf9c149c33e7f6ac9fe53

Change-Id: I7aa4c1c8506c064185cdd0f486abbf52e091591a
Co-Authored-By: Louis Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <Cathy.H.Zhang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
update the way to calculate the total number of IPs

The current method of calculating the total number of IPs is the total number
of ip in the address pool. But some ips, such as gateway ip, are not within
the address pool. some IP address in deleted address pools. In this case,
the number of IPS used may be larger than the total number of ips.

New method of calculation. the total number of IPs is the union of the
address pool and used IPs.

Partial-bug: #1838487

Change-Id: I9b05f31f12893e9d0cc987814a1489da49808161

commit_message:
DNM Check all extensions used in ML2/OVS-DVR scenarios

List of extensions to be enabled in tempest.conf is taken from
neutron-tempest-plugin jobs which are run on neutron with ML2/OVS.

It done to run all same tests as are run in ML2/OVS jobs and check
what will be failing with OVN.

Change-Id: Ie7047eadedabbeb1e021b0fa0918eafec62cbc31

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-30 12:08:09.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new ipv6-only job for gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia71cefd7397a616354924be40eb6fd44ba05f840
"}, {'created': '2019-07-30 12:26:36.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new ipv6-only job for gate

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new ipv6-only job for gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia71cefd7397a616354924be40eb6fd44ba05f840

commit_message:
Convert Pyroute2 byte results to strings

Pyroute2 can return information structures with values as bytes
instead of strings. In order to unify the output, those byte
parameters will be converted to string. This is needed in case of
having dictionaries with keys as bytes instead of strings.

Change-Id: Ic665b2c5e28d06e21190f06d9f3f8e8f8c3c792d
Closes-Bug: #1846360
(cherry picked from commit 592b44629905d68b39ec92604b882627f4844908)

Hi all, while rebasing this patch on master, conflict is, in this patch neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py is using SubnetPoolCreateUpdateError which is defined in neutron/common/exceptions, but this file has been removed in 3fbc9151c4988aa500434775773d5900b6014abf commit. As per my undestanding need to add SubnetPoolCreateUpdateError class in neutron_lib repo's neutron_lib/exceptions/__init__.py file. Could anyone please tell me what I should do here?"}, {'account_id': 26916, 'date': '2019-09-17 20:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-09-17 20:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I disagree that this is a bug in the first place, as noted in the bug report. However, in case I get out-voted on that point I have added some comments that should be addressed if we are going to consider accepting this change.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-09-17 21:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/447983/9 : FAILURE in 1h 44m 21s'}, {'account_id': 26916, 'date': '2019-09-18 19:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Ryan, will this be fine if I add validation in SubnetPoolReader of neutron/ipam/subnet_alloc.py as below,
    def validate_default_prefixlen_subnetpool(self,
                                             context,
                                             default_prefixlen,
                                             prefixes):
        for prefix in prefixes:
            if default_prefixlen < prefix.prefixlen:
                msg = _("Invalid subnetpool default prefixlen /%s")
                raise exceptions.IllegalSubnetPoolPrefixUpdate(
                    msg=msg % str(default_prefixlen))

Since SubnetPoolReader class already has a method with name validate_default_prefixlen(), I am thinking to add this new method name as validate_default_prefixlen_subnetpool(). Also IllegalSubnetPoolPrefixUpdate is temporary, we can modify it to SubnetPoolCreateUpdateError after we merge this class in neutron_lib since I didn't find any relevant exception class.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-09-18 21:32:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Again, let me reiterate I don't think we need to make this change at all. However, if we were to merge this we can move that logic into validate_default_prefixlen(). No need for another method IMO."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-09-19 01:03:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I tend to agree with Ryan, especially since this is fixable with 'openstack subnet pool set --default-prefix-length ...'"}, {'account_id': 26916, 'date': '2019-09-19 08:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Thanks Ryan, I understood the scenario.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:44:59.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

commit_message:
Check DefaultPrefixLength in Subnetpools

Apply a check in the default prefixlength in subnetpools
so that the prefixlength of the subnetpool can be checked with
network prefix length.
In case of inconsistency, do not allow creation of subnets from the
subnetpool.

Change-Id: I42e516e6e8cf06ac31e0f0459e438b5b0b88dd27
Closes-Bug: #1644433
Co-Authored-By: wujun <wujun@awcloud.com>

This changes the API behavior. It introduces a new field "available_ips".
The API change is not a simple bug fix. It is worth RFE (request for enhancement).

If you want to keep a change to a bug fix, it is not a good idea to introduce a new field. As I commented in the bug report, the way to calculate "total_ips" looks wrong. It is okay to fix it as a bug.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 10:36:27.000000000', 'message': "Refactor network ip availability api, add 'available_ips' filed

The 'available_ips' is represented the number of assignable ip address in
a network.

Currently, the network ip availability api only provide 'total_ips' and
'used_ips'. In some case, we can't accurately figure out the rest of ip
address only according to the two value. For example, the subnet has no
'ip_allocation_pools' or the 'ip_allocation_pools' was updated after
allocated some ips.

Closes-Bug: #1843211
Change-Id: I2ea4a240595f69ccd6f2c329387eb28d40c2997a
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor network ip availability api, add 'available_ips' filed

The 'available_ips' is represented the number of assignable ip address in
a network.

Currently, the network ip availability api only provide 'total_ips' and
'used_ips'. In some case, we can't accurately figure out the rest of ip
address only according to the two value. For example, the subnet has no
'ip_allocation_pools' or the 'ip_allocation_pools' was updated after
allocated some ips.

Closes-Bug: #1843211
Change-Id: I2ea4a240595f69ccd6f2c329387eb28d40c2997a

subject: Fix associating firewall group with DVR/L3HA port
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 21:21:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix associating firewall group with DVR/L3HA port

This commit enables to specify DVR/L3HA port for firewall group. We can
select a port with following device_owner in creating/updating firewall
group.

    * DVR:  'network:router_interface_distributed'
    * L3HA: 'network:ha_router_replicated_interface'

commit_message:
Fix associating firewall group with DVR/L3HA port

This commit enables to specify DVR/L3HA port for firewall group. We can
select a port with following device_owner in creating/updating firewall
group.

    * DVR:  'network:router_interface_distributed'
    * L3HA: 'network:ha_router_replicated_interface'

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <annp@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I05f0f652f3e43d5c1ce5ae7933991cf92a418920
Closes-Bug: #1762454
(cherry picked from commit f8e4a193e7930c2e9ef169c6e3be53a3e2a39dbe)

commit_message:
Fix associating firewall group with DVR/L3HA port

This commit enables to specify DVR/L3HA port for firewall group. We can
select a port with following device_owner in creating/updating firewall
group.

    * DVR:  'network:router_interface_distributed'
    * L3HA: 'network:ha_router_replicated_interface'

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <annp@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I05f0f652f3e43d5c1ce5ae7933991cf92a418920
Closes-Bug: #1762454
(cherry picked from commit f8e4a193e7930c2e9ef169c6e3be53a3e2a39dbe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 09:09:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix failure of getting IP without sg

VM can not get ip addresss if without any security group.

This issue has been discussed fistly by this link [0] and
fixed by related patch.

But, related patch was dropped afterwards. We can get detailed info from [1].
Actually, the problem is still here.

This patch is adding acl rule in 'ls_in_acl' table of logical flow
to allow DHCP and ICMPV6 traffic.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1536028
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1790900

Change-Id: If4732623314defcadbcb2838ac32973a24dbe450
Related-Bug: #1845457
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failure of getting IP without sg

VM can not get ip addresss if without any security group.

This issue has been discussed fistly by this link [0] and
fixed by related patch.

But, related patch was dropped afterwards. We can get detailed info from [1].
Actually, the problem is still here.

This patch is adding acl rule in 'ls_in_acl' table of logical flow
to allow DHCP and ICMPV6 traffic.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1536028
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1790900

Change-Id: If4732623314defcadbcb2838ac32973a24dbe450
Related-Bug: #1845457

[{'created': '2019-09-17 18:05:33.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-full-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

networking-midonet has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-full-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-full-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

networking-midonet has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-midonet-tempest-aio-ml2-full-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I6b2f536f94282a0c9f6551feecac9fcfd46d3655

subject: [train][goal] Define new neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-api-ipv6-only job
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 17:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 17:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to ipv6-only-deployment-and-testing'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-18 16:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-09-19 20:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Take a look at the neutron-tempest-plugin-dynamic-routing-bgp-all defined here https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652099/. It gives us pretty thorough IPv6 coverage. It runs a number of rather thorough scenario tests that validate peering, route advertisement, etc., all over single-stack IPv6. Do we actually need this?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-10-01 08:24:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I wonder if we can maybe first merge https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652099 and than add IPv6-only job based on  neutron-tempest-plugin-dynamic-routing job defined there. That way we would have only 2 jobs, both using zuulv3 syntax already.
This new job would run only IPv6 related tests, similar to what is now done in old job neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv6, like: https://openstack.fortnebula.com:13808/v1/AUTH_e8fd161dc34c421a979a9e6421f823e9/logs_81/678781/6/check/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv6/c0e3403/logs/testr_results.html.gz

Also, I don't think that having neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv6 job like it is now is enough to accomplish goal as this job is now using IPv4 for e.g. bgp_router_id: https://openstack.fortnebula.com:13808/v1/AUTH_e8fd161dc34c421a979a9e6421f823e9/logs_81/678781/6/check/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv6/c0e3403/logs/etc/neutron/bgp_dragent.ini.txt.gz and for local_ip for L2 agent: https://openstack.fortnebula.com:13808/v1/AUTH_e8fd161dc34c421a979a9e6421f823e9/logs_81/678781/6/check/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv6/c0e3403/logs/screen-q-agt.txt.gz
So those config options should be IMO changed in this new job.
What do You think about it Ryan and Ghanshyam?"}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-10-01 15:01:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In BGP, router ID's are simply a 32-bit number that we just happen to represent as an IPv4 address. If the router ID is you concern, I think it's misplaced. I know it's confusing, but bgp_router_id has nothing to do with IPv6. So even in a single-stack IPv6 deployment, routers will still transmit a router ID represented as an IPv4 address on the BGP session. bgp_router_id is irrelevant in terms of IPv6 support.

I would rather add an IPv6 job to neutron-tempest-plugin as you suggest if we are going to do it."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-10-01 21:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Take a look at the neutron-tempest-plugin-dynamic-routing-bgp-all
 > defined here https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652099/. It gives us
 > pretty thorough IPv6 coverage. It runs a number of rather thorough
 > scenario tests that validate peering, route advertisement, etc.,
 > all over single-stack IPv6. Do we actually need this?

yeah, this new job deploy all services, neutron and related like rabbitmq, DB etc over IPv6 and check if neutron is able to communicate internally and externally over IPv6.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-10-01 21:06:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

slaweq and I discussed this in IRC and agree on having a IPv6 job on neutron-tempest-plugin instead of this job[1]

I am preparing a new job. let's see how that behave - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/686043/

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-qa/%23openstack-qa.2019-10-01.log.html#t2019-10-01T19:44:38"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:41:34.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-api-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

neutron-dynamic-routing has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I6435b44e73a3a22e2bf4461d2dec18001cba6321

commit_message:
Pin neutron version to stable/queens in unit test

the stable/queens of neutron-vpnaas no longer works with master
of neutron, running unit tests locally (w/o Zuul cloner) now fails.

Change-Id: I94339e013a6e710d77f72f4aa636b25d78182fbb

commit_message:
Remove tempest tests that have moved to neutron-tempest-plugin

This patch removes all tempest tests from neutron-dynamic-routing
repository as all of them are now moved to neutron-tempest-plugin repo.
It also removes all tempest job definitions which are now replaced by
job neutron-tempest-plugin-dynamic-routing defined in
neutron-tempest-plugin repo directly.

Change-Id: I94a443c92fe2317ba2591ae3a227ec8df82ec294

commit_message:
ovs-dpdk support in neutron-sanity-check

While creating bridges, pass the optional argument 'datapath_type'.
This parameter is read from openvswitch.ini conf file.

Closes-Bug: #1842517

Change-Id: I05f0484636e4da6290c750a1eabd5f9d09588008

commit_message:
Blacklist specific versions of sqlalchemy

Sqlachemy 1.3.0-2 introduced a reqgression regarding join
ambiguity [1]. This was fixed in version 1.3.3. This change
blacklists the affected versions in the project requirements.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/4584

Change-Id: I330689ff01c0e0a78d0c743f6aaf1d71ce7b0447
Closes-Bug: 1833574

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-10-10 19:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry Nguyen, but I don't recommend this approach because this is not solving the problem.

I've tested only with reboots. During the reboot, the same port (different UUID but same name) is detached and attached again. The OVS agent has an event triggered thread to detect those events and this is working fine. But the OVS agent checks this information in a polling loop. Depending on when those events are check, we can have:
- Detach detected --> removed from the QoS cache; attach detected --> QoS policy applied
- Detach + attach detected in the same loop [1] --> because the port is already created and present in br-int, the port is never handled as "removed" and thus the port is never deleted from the QoS cache in the extension manager. When the "added" port is handled by the QoS extension, the policy is not applied again because there are no changes and does exist in the cache.

To solve the reboot *occasional" problem (1 out of 3 tests done manually in my testing environment ended without the QoS policy applied in the interface), we need a new way to treat when a port is "removed" and then "added" in the same polling cycle.


What I don't understand is how this is happening in during migrations. In this case, the destination OVS agent does not have the port information in the policy_map cache. Can you confirm that migration is also affected by this bug? 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/2ffaa40b43ceb19f1584afd3d8a9c18efeca7f6a/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L1585-L1591'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-10-10 19:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 30922, 'date': '2019-10-11 03:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > not solving the problem.
 > 
 > I've tested only with reboots. During the reboot, the same port
 > (different UUID but same name) is detached and attached again. The
 > OVS agent has an event triggered thread to detect those events and
 > this is working fine. But the OVS agent checks this information in
 > a polling loop. Depending on when those events are check, we can
 > have:
 > - Detach detected --> removed from the QoS cache; attach detected
 > --> QoS policy applied
 > - Detach + attach detected in the same loop [1] --> because the
 > port is already created and present in br-int, the port is never
 > handled as "removed" and thus the port is never deleted from the
 > QoS cache in the extension manager. When the "added" port is
 > handled by the QoS extension, the policy is not applied again
 > because there are no changes and does exist in the cache.
 > 
 > To solve the reboot *occasional" problem (1 out of 3 tests done
 > manually in my testing environment ended without the QoS policy
 > applied in the interface), we need a new way to treat when a port
 > is "removed" and then "added" in the same polling cycle.
 > 
 > 
 > What I don't understand is how this is happening in during
 > migrations. In this case, the destination OVS agent does not have
 > the port information in the policy_map cache. Can you confirm that
 > migration is also affected by this bug?
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/2ffaa40b43ceb19f1584afd3d8a9c18efeca7f6a/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L1585-L1591

yes, you are right. I see that workflow when i trace in the code. So do you have any idea to fix this bug?'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-10-13 14:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Sometimes a vm gets its interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in

commit_message:
Fixing lost QoS on interfaces after operation like: reboot hard, live migration..

Sometimes a vm gets its interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its QoS on it interfaces was lost and qos extension doesn't restore the qos.

Change-Id: I83a4d2c0ed480da3d3aa6a46350b95fac8f4f415
Closes-Bug: #1845161

commit_message:
Use fwaas_v2_log constants from neutron-lib

The fwaas_v2_log constants and 'FIREWALL_LOG_DRIVER_NAME' are
removed from neutron-fwaas, using them from neutron-lib instead.

Closes-bug: #1848851

commit_message:
NSSDB invocation fix for Libreswan v3.19 and later

On Jan 15, 2017 libreswan team released version 3.19 that introduced
a change that requires to specify the flag --nssdir for NSS DB location.

This change adds the missing --nssdir option in the Libreswan device driver
and also ammends the test script to cover the change in the driver.

Change-Id: I9d438e13c229d472b555b66f216ab0ca3447e34e
Closes-Bug: #1711456

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 18:19:41.000000000', 'message': 'ICMPv6 is not an available protocol when creating firewall rule

When creating IPv6 firewall rule, the network protocol that can be
selected is ICMP TCP UDP or null.
But in fact, ICMPv6 is the message control protocol we actually need
for the firewall rule whose ip-version = 6.

This patch fixes this bug with the following logic:
When creating firewall rule whose "ip-version = 6, protocol = ipv6-icmp"
, we should consider that the "icmp" refers to "ipv6-icmp".

Closes-Bug: #1799904
Change-Id: I27cff5ba9986f30fa4c7ddb12db920300edd521b
(cherry picked from commit fa48d16d694269b6b4245b90454448f8e9895ed8)
'}]
commit_message:
ICMPv6 is not an available protocol when creating firewall rule

When creating IPv6 firewall rule, the network protocol that can be
selected is ICMP TCP UDP or null.
But in fact, ICMPv6 is the message control protocol we actually need
for the firewall rule whose ip-version = 6.

This patch fixes this bug with the following logic:
When creating firewall rule whose "ip-version = 6, protocol = ipv6-icmp"
, we should consider that the "icmp" refers to "ipv6-icmp".

Closes-Bug: #1799904
Change-Id: I27cff5ba9986f30fa4c7ddb12db920300edd521b
(cherry picked from commit fa48d16d694269b6b4245b90454448f8e9895ed8)
