It is also passing the related tempest tests proposed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695291/


$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile create --name azp-amphora-1 --provider amphora 
usage: openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile create
       [-h] [-f {json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN]
       [--max-width <integer>] [--fit-width] [--print-empty] [--noindent]
       [--prefix PREFIX] --name <name> --provider <provider name>
       --availability-zone-data <availability_zone_data>
openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile create: error: argument --availability-zone-data is required

$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile create --name azp-amphora-1 --provider amphora --availability-zone-data "{\"compute_zone\": \"az1\"}"
Provider 'amphora' reports error: Nova availability zone az1 not found. (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-4db86b8d-8440-4a0e-921c-d96a50783482)

$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile create --name azp-amphora-1 --provider amphora --availability-zone-data "{\"compute_zone\": \"nova\"}"
+------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                  | Value                                |
+------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| id                     | fdc05ffc-15c4-427a-ae06-d9e3fb5d7670 |
| name                   | azp-amphora-1                        |
| provider_name          | amphora                              |
| availability_zone_data | {"compute_zone": "nova"}             |
+------------------------+--------------------------------------+

$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile show azp-amphora-1
+------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                  | Value                                |
+------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| id                     | fdc05ffc-15c4-427a-ae06-d9e3fb5d7670 |
| name                   | azp-amphora-1                        |
| provider_name          | amphora                              |
| availability_zone_data | {"compute_zone": "nova"}             |
+------------------------+--------------------------------------+

$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzone create --name az-1 --availabilityzoneprofile azp-amphora-1
+------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                        | Value                                |
+------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| name                         | az-1                                 |
| availability_zone_profile_id | fdc05ffc-15c4-427a-ae06-d9e3fb5d7670 |
| enabled                      | True                                 |
| description                  |                                      |
+------------------------------+--------------------------------------+

$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile delete azp-amphora-1
Availability Zone Profile fdc05ffc-15c4-427a-ae06-d9e3fb5d7670 is in use and cannot be modified. (HTTP 409) (Request-ID: req-c484f849-f35f-4ce1-84f0-050e93b2a328)

$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzone delete az-1
$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile delete azp-amphora-1
$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzoneprofile show azp amphora-1                                                                                          
Unable to locate azp-amphora-1 in availability_zone_profiles
$ openstack loadbalancer availabilityzone show az-1                                                                                                               
Unable to locate az-1 in availability_zones'}]

commit_message:
Availability Zone admin API

Adds the ability for admins to create/manage availability_zones
and profiles for use with upcoming functionality. Works like flavors.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694057/
Change-Id: I468d9fdf8c9d0898f9e30f04ac233510a10a53fc

[{'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Marked as WIP as I will add unit tests later (if the patch set is not shot to pieces)'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-08 10:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-08 13:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-19 16:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:18:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:08:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 24919, 'date': '2018-02-21 13:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-02-21 14:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24919, 'date': '2018-02-21 20:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24919, 'date': '2018-02-21 20:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-01 18:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm OK with this in principle, although I'd like to see some justification for each resource type for why this is something that's likely to have extensions installed (i.e. the existence of a defined extension point in neutron). Because value_specs is a hack, that has nevertheless proved somewhat useful in cases where changes to the Neutron API have moved faster than our ability to keep up.

What I'm not interested in is adding hacks for the benefit of proprietary neutron plugins that are not using a defined extension point. Folks doing this are clearly capable of writing Python, and the process of substituting a custom replacement plugin is easy. It's not upstream's job to support proprietary extensions.

-1 because the release version is wrong."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-03-02 08:02:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

> What I'm not interested in is adding hacks for the benefit of proprietary neutron plugins that are not using a defined extension point

That was exactly my point earlier, if you can write a custom neutron extension, you can also write a custom heat resource plugin;)

If it's a standard extension in neutron, we can have them as normal properties in the resource plugins as we've for many other resources.

I agree with Zane that they have been useful at times. Another issue with value_specs is you can overwrite anything in the properties by specifying it again in value_specs, which can be confusing and error prone."}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-03-02 11:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-03-02 12:05:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I agree that value_specs is a hack, however, I don't understand why some resources have value_specs as others don't. I understand that not all resources should have value_specs as a property, but the ones I proposed in this patch set should in my opinion.

> Another issue with value_specs is you can overwrite anything in the properties by specifying it again in value_specs, which can be confusing and error prone.

This is not true as there is a check for that neutron.NeutronResource.validate_properties(). From the documentation: 

>Validates to ensure nothing in value_specs overwrites any key that exists in the schema.
> Also ensures that shared and tenant_id is not specified in value_specs.

PS: I updated my patch set according to your comments. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-03-02 12:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> This is not true as there is a check for that 
You're right. I forgot about that. What's the issue for you to write a custome resource plugin to use with your custom neutron extension? The resource plugin interface is meant for that."}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:35:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27796, 'date': '2018-03-05 11:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

> I understand that not all resources should have value_specs as a property, but the ones I proposed in this patch set should in my opinion.

Great. Why? Help me understand as a reviewer and non-neutron-expert why the usefulness of the hack outweighs the cloud interoperability concerns in these particular cases.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-03-12 12:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2019-11-25 16:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

This patch has been flagged in the 2019 Heat Patch Triage Effort [0] as ready for abandonment.

Reasons for abandonment include inactivity for a lengthy period of time, triviality of the patch, inattentiveness to review feedback, and other reasons.

This patch has been targeted for forced abandonment by review.  If you don't mind this, then you have nothing to do.

If you believe this patch has value and has been selected for abandonment in error, please bring this patch up to standard and give a reason for its inclusion in the Heat project.

Thank you,
David Peacock
dpeacock@redhat.com

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 16:41:37.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Generalize value_specs in Neutron resources

The property `value_specs` is lifted from a few (seemingly) random
Neutron resources to their base class. Only FloatingIP creates the
`value_specs` property by itself for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I9068db11450f52f9461567649fcff293423242d6

commit_message:
Add value_specs to some Neutron resources

The property `value_specs` is currently only present in a few
(seemingly) random Neutron resources. We add the `value_specs`
property to all Neutron resources which implement the standard
attributes.

Change-Id: I9068db11450f52f9461567649fcff293423242d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-08 17:04:21.000000000', 'message': 'Store updated_at for all non-create actions for resource

This patch propose to store updated time to database when
changing any action states for resource (not including create)
when we try to set status. This change affects both legacy and
convergence stack.
Related-Bug: #1669608
Related-Bug: #1653202

Change-Id: Icfcf56285cecccc309572e8c671f2672aafc90be
'}, {'created': '2017-10-09 15:26:34.000000000', 'message': 'Store updated_at for all non-create actions for resource

This patch propose to store updated time to database when
changing any action states for resource (not including create)
when we try to set status. This change affects both legacy and
convergence stack.
Related-Bug: #1669608

commit_message:
Store updated_at for all non-create actions for resource

This patch propose to store updated time to database when
changing any action states for resource (not including create)
when we try to set status. This change affects both legacy and
convergence stack.
Story: #1669608

Story: #1653202
Task: #24262

Change-Id: Icfcf56285cecccc309572e8c671f2672aafc90be

subject: Store updated_at for all non-create actions for stack

(2 comments)

IMHO it's wrong to change the updated_time at both the beginning and the end of the operation. The updated_time does not mean the time the status was updated; it means the time the stack was updated. (For the record I agree that suspend/resume/check should count as updating the stack.)

Also, I don't believe we need to change the behaviour of updated_time for legacy deletes any more: Ie23ba5f4538a8f5c2e7d64caa6cbe530c013b520"}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2019-11-25 16:04:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Reasons for abandonment include inactivity for a lengthy period of time, triviality of the patch, inattentiveness to review feedback, and other reasons.

This patch has been targeted for forced abandonment by review.  If you don't mind this, then you have nothing to do.

If you believe this patch has value and has been selected for abandonment in error, please bring this patch up to standard and give a reason for its inclusion in the Heat project.

Thank you,
David Peacock
dpeacock@redhat.com

commit_message:
Store updated_at for all non-create actions for stack

We have some race conditions that we can't tell which state of
actions are real. We needs more information for each action
states to know when exactly the stack statu was setted. This
patch propose to store updated time to database when changing
any action states for stack (not including create) when we try
to set status. This change affects both legacy and convergence
stack.
Story: #1653202
Task: #17646

Change-Id: I3075de0aeacae3de5600fa112d15aa77b6dd4e4f

commit_message:
Make log socket available to chrooted filesystem

Had an issue where HAProxy logs could not be found.

The /dev/log socket was not available to the chrooted filesystem.
We need to mount the socket and persist it.

Change-Id: I2a1ce48f90c5f85b1238842f17ad2c9708333629

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-07-31 18:50:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

for-each can't be a pure Macro because the for_each part can be, and often is, something that is only resolvable at runtime (e.g. get_attr). You _might_ be able to make some sort of unholy Macro/Function hybrid. Otherwise we'd just have to call this a known limitation rather than a bug."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

commit_message:
Replace for_each keys before parsing

Change function 'repeat' to inherit Macro class,
to replace for_each keys before parsing its args.
There is an example we have to fix:
 repeat:
   template:
     volume_id: {if: [<%boot%>, {get_resource: boot_vol},
                      {get_resource: data_vol}]}
     device_name: {if: [<%boot%>, 'vda', 'vdb']}
   for_each:
     <%boot%>: {get_param: boot_flag}

Closes-Bug: #1675368
Change-Id: I0ba9dda8daf2efe71cc982611dee29c519f2cd8e

commit_message:
Add stack v2 api router

This patch adds heat api v2 for stack operations.
Also refactor controller and utils for stack.

Change-Id: I0accd03e3d64f14d9401ab1fd0204a92df84903c
Blueprint: v2-api

commit_message:
Remove the file encoding which is unnecessary

Basically, the commit removes the file encoding - since jenkins is fine
with it, means it was really unnecessary and the change makes sense.

Change-Id: Iee1397f4fb06f9eedf12e1a08cbbf15a6a8fadda

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-09-22 01:40:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

> (1 comment)

Sadly the issue with the protocol parsing is something that is being fed from here, (THT)[0]. I agree its something we should change, but its not something we need to fix at this time, given we're porting the existing functionality, even if that functionality is a little flawed.  All that said, I would be 100% supportive of adding ip version parsing and fixing our use of erroneous protocols.

[0]: 

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677237/21/deployment/kubernetes/kubernetes-worker-baremetal-ansible.yaml@61
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677237/21/deployment/keepalived/keepalived-container-puppet.yaml@78"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-23 08:22:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > Sadly the issue with the protocol parsing is something that is
 > being fed from here, (THT)[0]. I agree its something we should
 > change, but its not something we need to fix at this time, given
 > we're porting the existing functionality, even if that
 > functionality is a little flawed.  All that said, I would be 100%
 > supportive of adding ip version parsing and fixing our use of
 > erroneous protocols.
 > 
 > [0]:
 > 


 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677237/21/deployment/kubernetes/kubernetes-worker-baremetal-ansible.yaml@61

Actually I think you misunderstood this. The ipv4 there is about allowing encapsulation of ipv4 packets inside ipv4. I.e ip-in-ip encapsulation[1]. It is not at all about which table ('iptables' or 'ip6tables') the rule should be created in.

To control wheater the rule should be placed in 'iptables' or 'ip6tables' in puppet you would use the 'provider'[2] flag. (Unfortunately the puppet-tripleo[3] module assumes that we want to open the same ports for both ipv4 and ipv6, this needs fixing ...)

But, the code[4] in https://review.opendev.org/680485 is as far as I understand it using the 'proto' flag to decide if the rule should go in ipv4 tables or ipv6 tables. This is not correct.


 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677237/21/deployment/keepalived/keepalived-container-puppet.yaml@78

oh, yes. Correct tcp/udp is'nt the only protocols, there are several protocols that don't use tcp/udp. icmp, gre, ospf and indeed vrrp in this case.


[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/514730/5/extraconfig/services/kubernetes-worker.yaml
[2] https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/firewall#example-of-an-ipv6-rule
[3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/firewall/rule.pp#L127-L144
[4]"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-23 08:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

I missed the [4] reference in the previous review comment.
And -1, I think https://review.opendev.org/680485 needs a follow up to fix the logic which control if rules are created in ip6tables or iptables first.

[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680485/6/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-firewall/tasks/tripleo_firewall_add.yml'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-09-23 14:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

 > > erroneous protocols.

 > > [0]:

 >

 > > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677237/21/deployment/kubernetes/kubernetes-worker-baremetal-ansible.yaml@61
 > 
 > Actually I think you misunderstood this. The ipv4 there is about
 > allowing encapsulation of ipv4 packets inside ipv4. I.e ip-in-ip
 > encapsulation[1]. It is not at all about which table ('iptables' or
 > 'ip6tables') the rule should be created in.
 > 
 > To control wheater the rule should be placed in 'iptables' or
 > 'ip6tables' in puppet you would use the 'provider'[2] flag.
 > (Unfortunately the puppet-tripleo[3] module assumes that we want to
 > open the same ports for both ipv4 and ipv6, this needs fixing ...)
 > 
I agree, this should be fixed, however I think that needs to be resolved in a follow-on review in TripleO-Ansible as it would be a new feature which we would shoot for the U cycle.
 >
 > But, the code[4] in https://review.opendev.org/680485 is as far as
 > I understand it using the 'proto' flag to decide if the rule should
 > go in ipv4 tables or ipv6 tables. This is not correct.
 > 
The protocol parsing is using != (ipv4|ipv6) is being done to rule out irrelevant protocols for ip(?6)tables and creating all rules, everywhere, just as we're doing in puppet. At this time we don't want to add new functionality, we're simply shooting for a drop in replacement with matching functionality which is using "proto" to determine "provider"[0] in puppet-tripleo.
 > 
 > > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677237/21/deployment/keepalived/keepalived-container-puppet.yaml@78
 > 
 > oh, yes. Correct tcp/udp is'nt the only protocols, there are
 > several protocols that don't use tcp/udp. icmp, gre, ospf and
 > indeed vrrp in this case.
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/514730/5/extraconfig/services/kubernetes-worker.yaml
 > [2] https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/firewall#example-of-an-ipv6-rule
 > [3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/firewall/rule.pp#L127-L144
 > [4]

[0] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/firewall/rule.pp#L127-L136'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-23 14:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

> The protocol parsing is using != (ipv4|ipv6) is being done
 > to rule out irrelevant protocols for ip(?6)tables and creating
 > all rules, everywhere, just as we're doing in puppet. At this
 > time we don't want to add new functionality, we're simply
 > shooting for a drop in replacement with matching functionality
 > which is using "proto" to determine "provider"[0] in
 > puppet-tripleo.

? I'm not following, nothing is using "proto" to determine the provider in puppet-tripleo. There is one special case condition to make sure the correct proto is used for 'icmp' where the correct proto for ipv6 is 'ipv6-icmp', this also sets the provider. _else_ the ip6tables provider is added to the $ipv6 hash in L133. The $ipv6 hash is then merged with the rule into $ipv6_rule in L147.

There is nothing doing a condition if $proto ==/!= 'ipvX'.
In the ansible module[2], $proto is used to make this decision and it is wrong.


This rule[1] should go in both iptables and ip6tables. It will currently only be created in iptables in the ansible module. puppet-tripleo will add it in both. Why should we start denying ipv4 encapsulated in ipv6 when switching to ansible?



[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/kubernetes/kubernetes-worker-baremetal-ansible.yaml#L61-L62
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680485/6/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-firewall/tasks/tripleo_firewall_add.yml'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-09-23 16:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

> > The protocol parsing is using != (ipv4|ipv6) is being done
 > > to rule out irrelevant protocols for ip(?6)tables and creating
 > > all rules, everywhere, just as we're doing in puppet. At this
 > > time we don't want to add new functionality, we're simply
 > > shooting for a drop in replacement with matching functionality
 > > which is using "proto" to determine "provider"[0] in
 > > puppet-tripleo.
 > 
 > ? I'm not following, nothing is using "proto" to determine the
 > provider in puppet-tripleo. There is one special case condition to
 > make sure the correct proto is used for 'icmp' where the correct
 > proto for ipv6 is 'ipv6-icmp', this also sets the provider. _else_
 > the ip6tables provider is added to the $ipv6 hash in L133. The
 > $ipv6 hash is then merged with the rule into $ipv6_rule in L147.
 > 
 > There is nothing doing a condition if $proto ==/!= 'ipvX'.
 > In the ansible module[2], $proto is used to make this decision and
 > it is wrong.
 > 
As mentioned in the other review, if you feel this is wrong, please submit a change to correct it. I would be happy to review it and get it merged.
 > 
 > This rule[1] should go in both iptables and ip6tables. It will
 > currently only be created in iptables in the ansible module.
 > puppet-tripleo will add it in both. Why should we start denying
 > ipv4 encapsulated in ipv6 when switching to ansible?
 > 
Based on the rule comparisons we did when we implemented the initial port we haven't found anything to be missing, that said, if we have overlooked some functionality please submit a review so we can get it fixed.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/kubernetes/kubernetes-worker-baremetal-ansible.yaml#L61-L62
 > [2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680485/6/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-firewall/tasks/tripleo_firewall_add.yml'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-09-24 13:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-10-04 16:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-10-09 18:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 15:40:24.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Convert firewall rules to use TripleO-Ansible

This change converts our filewall deployment practice to use
the tripleo-ansible firewall role. This change creates a new
"firewall_rules" object which is queried using YAQL from the
"FirewallRules" resource.

Change-Id: I1be209a04f599d1d018e730c92f1fc8dd9bf884b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 17:29:48.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Convert firewall rules to use TripleO-Ansible

This change converts our filewall deployment practice to use
the tripleo-ansible firewall role. This change creates a new
"firewall_rules" object which is queried using YAQL from the
"FirewallRules" resource.

A new parameter has been added allowing users to input
additional firewall rules as needed. The new parameter is
`ExtraFirewallRules` and will be merged on top of the YAQL
interface.

Depends-On: Ibe4bed6b27cb774dabc40e28a61032bc399c2eae
Change-Id: I1be209a04f599d1d018e730c92f1fc8dd9bf884b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert firewall rules to use TripleO-Ansible

This change converts our filewall deployment practice to use
the tripleo-ansible firewall role. This change creates a new
"firewall_rules" object which is queried using YAQL from the
"FirewallRules" resource.

A new parameter has been added allowing users to input
additional firewall rules as needed. The new parameter is
`ExtraFirewallRules` and will be merged on top of the YAQL
interface.

Depends-On: Ie5d0f51d7efccd112847d3f1edf5fd9cdb1edeed
Change-Id: I1be209a04f599d1d018e730c92f1fc8dd9bf884b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 22785, 'date': '2016-08-29 18:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2016-08-29 18:46:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 22785, 'date': '2016-08-29 19:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-29 20:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Fix resume after check while resource is suspended

Added a boolean to track a resource's resumable status. Resource
may resume only if it is resumable. Removed duplicate code from
test cases.

Change-Id: Ica0296ea2181698c9c6abd432c2e298889339e48
Closes-Bug: #1506042

and you try to create resource, which uses property
with this constraint it usually fails with message:
Property error... does not validate... (constraint not found)

commit_message:
Add msg to log to exception constraint not found

When new custom constraint is added to Heat
and you try to create resource, which uses property
with this constraint it usually fails with message:
Property error... does not validate... (constraint not found)
which is not very informative. Because to resolve the
problem you need to reinstall Heat like:
'python setup.py install' in Heat directory.
I have added this info message to log so it would be
easier to solve such common problem.

Change-Id: I8cdd931c29118abde43d85cdc3854e5f8f6edf08

commit_message:
Pass insecure and ca_certificate option for cfn transport

This fix passes the insecure and ca_certificate option to the
os-collect-config.conf for the cfn transport.
The agent implementation is in changes
I4f6262967ad346c6ff103cb359b02b81ef71573f and
I0773f4e1db1a443d19f12f531fb88ca78e9d783d.
Closes-Bug: #1482510

Change-Id: I8201b072608c5683257df28c0824e89a021a4bcb

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - retype attached replication fix

Fixes for retyping attached volumes when moving from
non-replicated to replication enabled volume type.
Cases fixed:
-Retype to metro replication with existing pairs.
-Retype to non-replicated after retyping to metro.
-Retype to asynchronous replication with existing pairs present.
-Delete attached volume with asynchronous replication after
attaching to an instance.

Change-Id: Ibbf04dedade6e85649ec702574ce51ce82fc8733
Closes-Bug: #1851371

commit_message:
Disable overcloud image validation

To speed up CI and development process it would be better to disable
this script. CI will fail anyway even without this validation. Users
will be able to enable it if/when they decides to use tripleo-upgrade
for production upgrade.

Closes-bug: #1844567
Change-Id: Ia5a767491c2f297b396c5cc937c1495e4267a4e3
(cherry picked from commit 72dd2c49e37db7ed014f297e3b7aad8dc22f60fe)
(cherry picked from commit 87639f0badbb5873f03d5c69ae75b0c828464f55)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 09:49:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix action Apply ignoring managed-by arg

From the very beginning (06036fd6dba3ba4b9a13052ea95a08ebcc97501e), the
action apply was ignoring the passed --managed-by values and was always
taking defaults ('paunch').

Fix this and provide no upgrade/update impact, which is for whatever
--managed-by value given to paunch, perform all checks and searches
also for that historically "wrong" value 'paunch':

* if a container needs to be (re)started by a new 'managed-by', make sure
  it can be found by the default 'paunch' value as well, then reset its
  managed-by to the desired value.

Closes-bug: #1853812

Change-Id: If129bbc1ff32941d06ff480f26870b10840591e0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 000a68b39312eb297bb7a2f91a5e4adfd840b5d3)
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix action Apply ignoring managed-by arg

From the very beginning (06036fd6dba3ba4b9a13052ea95a08ebcc97501e), the
action apply was ignoring the passed --managed-by values and was always
taking defaults ('paunch').

Fix this and provide no upgrade/update impact, which is for whatever
--managed-by value given to paunch, perform all checks and searches
also for that historically "wrong" value 'paunch':

* if a container needs to be (re)started by a new 'managed-by', make sure
  it can be found by the default 'paunch' value as well, then reset its
  managed-by to the desired value.

Closes-bug: #1853812

Change-Id: If129bbc1ff32941d06ff480f26870b10840591e0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 12ccf36b0e7f9b233b8b71a21fe24b241ecb639b)

commit_message:
Retain boot device selection upon boot image change

When changing boot image in libvirt domain, note current boot
device and restore it if the image being changed resides on
the active boot device.

Prior to this patch, as a side-effect of changing boot image,
boot device selection could get reset.

Change-Id: Ic848882acbd446effbdf9b761d4ac1025d24c324

This patch sets dependency of rabbitmq_package_state from
rabbitmq_upgrade flag. So when rabbitmq_upgrade is set to True, we need
packages to be updated.
When it's False, they should be left unchanged.

commit_message:
Change rabbitmq_package_state logic

This patch sets dependency of rabbitmq_package_state from
rabbitmq_upgrade flag. So when rabbitmq_upgrade is set to True, we need
packages to be updated.
When it's False, they should be left unchanged.

Change-Id: I709adf406d8ffc493d632e0a8382938feb7c2d7c
(cherry picked from commit 23c34a79a200c615af19abe8bc77ff87c2d10267)

[{'created': '2019-11-28 17:49:43.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Bring libvirt domain down prior to any change

When Redfish emulator is running against libvirt virtualization
backend, any changes being done to domain are not applied for
as long as the domain is up. This leads to two nuisances:

- REST API is not really REST-ful meaning that successfully
  applied change is not reflected in the document tree
- Multiple changes done to live domain XML tree may override one
  another because N-1 change done to a domain is not visible
  to N's change

The solution offered by this patch has been discovered in the
early days of computers and has been used with great success ever
after - we will simply turn the domain off and on again whenever
any change is about to be done to the domain.

Change-Id: I7b9d4ca23d5eb42b791c9399dbe03f921664569e

commit_message:
Bring libvirt domain down prior to any change

When Redfish emulator is running against libvirt virtualization
backend, any changes being done to domain are not applied for
as long as the domain is up. This leads to two nuisances:

- REST API is not really REST-ful meaning that successfully
  applied change is not reflected in the document tree
- Multiple changes done to live domain XML tree may override one
  another because N-1 change done to a domain is not visible
  to N's change

The solution offered by this patch has been discovered in the
early days of computers and has been used with great success ever
after - we will simply turn the domain off and on again for the
time a change is being done to the domain.

Change-Id: I7b9d4ca23d5eb42b791c9399dbe03f921664569e

commit_message:
Remove escape characters from container command

Ansible outputs JSON-encoded strings which does not work with
container clis (ex. docker). Write to a temp file instead.

Change-Id: I554d62265ecf0e890f9545d871afe85c0344f747
Closes-Bug: #1847707

commit_message:
Stop trying to power off nodes if manage_boot is False

When manage_boot is False, we do not power on the machines on starting
introspection, nor do we power them off on aborting. We should not
power off on finishing introspection either, let's leave it up to ironic.

Change-Id: If8115f8d592e1b24b07ef52bcd703d10763c1f00
Story: #1528920

commit_message:
Deploy the undercloud/overcloud containerized in newer versions

We are missing to deploy the environment
with containers depending on the version, also the undercloud
is with <20GB in the disk, and the free space validation fails.

Change-Id: Ibcdfd71b9280615aedc4d59ef0c566c475f15d0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 09:48:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix action Apply ignoring managed-by arg

From the very beginning (06036fd6dba3ba4b9a13052ea95a08ebcc97501e), the
action apply was ignoring the passed --managed-by values and was always
taking defaults ('paunch').

Fix this and provide no upgrade/update impact, which is for whatever
--managed-by value given to paunch, perform all checks and searches
also for that historically "wrong" value 'paunch':

* if a container needs to be (re)started by a new 'managed-by', make sure
  it can be found by the default 'paunch' value as well, then reset its
  managed-by to the desired value.

Closes-bug: #1853812

Change-Id: If129bbc1ff32941d06ff480f26870b10840591e0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 000a68b39312eb297bb7a2f91a5e4adfd840b5d3)
'}, {'created': '2019-11-29 12:25:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix action Apply ignoring managed-by arg

From the very beginning (06036fd6dba3ba4b9a13052ea95a08ebcc97501e), the
action apply was ignoring the passed --managed-by values and was always
taking defaults ('paunch').

Fix this and provide no upgrade/update impact, which is for whatever
--managed-by value given to paunch, perform all checks and searches
also for that historically "wrong" value 'paunch':

* if a container needs to be (re)started by a new 'managed-by', make sure
  it can be found by the default 'paunch' value as well, then reset its
  managed-by to the desired value.

Closes-bug: #1853812

Change-Id: If129bbc1ff32941d06ff480f26870b10840591e0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 12ccf36b0e7f9b233b8b71a21fe24b241ecb639b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix action Apply ignoring managed-by arg

From the very beginning (06036fd6dba3ba4b9a13052ea95a08ebcc97501e), the
action apply was ignoring the passed --managed-by values and was always
taking defaults ('paunch').

Fix this and provide no upgrade/update impact, which is for whatever
--managed-by value given to paunch, perform all checks and searches
also for that historically "wrong" value 'paunch':

* if a container needs to be (re)started by a new 'managed-by', make sure
  it can be found by the default 'paunch' value as well, then reset its
  managed-by to the desired value.

Closes-bug: #1853812

Change-Id: If129bbc1ff32941d06ff480f26870b10840591e0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 12ccf36b0e7f9b233b8b71a21fe24b241ecb639b)

commit_message:
build: remove link to failed log before creating

Kolla allows to create separate logs per image. It also makes very
useful symlinks to those builds which fail.

But it fails to do that on next builds:

ERROR:kolla.common.utils:aodh-base Failed with status: error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./tools/build.py", line 40, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "./tools/build.py", line 30, in main
    statuses = build.run_build()
  File "/home/hrw/devel/kolla/kolla/image/build.py", line 1333, in run_build
    results = kolla.summary()
  File "/home/hrw/devel/kolla/kolla/image/build.py", line 1037, in summary
    "000_FAILED_%s.log" % name))
FileExistsError: [Errno 17] File exists: 'aodh-base.log' -> 'logs/debian-source-buster/000_FAILED_aodh-base.log'

Change-Id: I85132bbace63c8b386f69ddb758a3b52e52c0ef0

commit_message:
Add more condition to check sg member exist

Only check sg object is not enough, we should also
check sg'ports is {} or not. Otherwise the old conjunction
will still exist.

Change-Id: I10588e73a9da7fdd43677f9247c176811dd68c62
Closes-Bug: #1854131
(cherry picked from commit 5cb0ff418a0794d060001a7313561c4cfb584d0e)

commit_message:
Add more condition to check sg member exist

Only check sg object is not enough, we should also
check sg'ports is {} or not. Otherwise the old conjunction
will still exist.

Change-Id: I10588e73a9da7fdd43677f9247c176811dd68c62
Closes-Bug: #1854131
(cherry picked from commit 5cb0ff418a0794d060001a7313561c4cfb584d0e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-19 18:32:09.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Serialize subnet creating depending on the network ID

TODO

Change-Id: Iecbb096e0b7e080a3e0299ea340f8b03e87ddfd2
Closes-Bug: #1852777
'}, {'created': '2019-11-21 11:57:03.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Serialize subnet creating depending on the network ID

TODO

Change-Id: Iecbb096e0b7e080a3e0299ea340f8b03e87ddfd2
Closes-Bug: #1852777
'}, {'created': '2019-11-21 14:06:03.000000000', 'message': 'Serialize subnet creating depending on the network ID

Add a new DB table "network_subnet_lock". The primary key will be the
network_id. When a subnet is created, inside the write context during
the "subnet" object creation, a register in the mentioned table is
created or updated. This will enforce the serialization of the "subnet"
registers belonging to the same network, due to the write lock in the
DB.

This will solve the problem of attending several "subnet" creation
requests, described in the related bug. If several subnets with the
same CIDR are processed in parallel, the implemented logic won't reject
them because any of them will not contain the information of each other.

This DB lock will also work in case of distributed servers because the
lock is not enforced in the server logic but in the DB backend.

Change-Id: Iecbb096e0b7e080a3e0299ea340f8b03e87ddfd2
Closes-Bug: #1852777

commit_message:
Serialize subnet creating depending on the network ID

Add a new DB table "network_subnet_lock". The primary key will be the
network_id. When a subnet is created, inside the write context during
the "subnet" object creation, a register in the mentioned table is
created or updated. This will enforce the serialization of the "subnet"
registers belonging to the same network, due to the write lock in the
DB.

This will solve the problem of attending several "subnet" creation
requests, described in the related bug. If several subnets with the
same CIDR are processed in parallel, the implemented logic won't reject
them because any of them will not contain the information of each other.

This DB lock will also work in case of distributed servers because the
lock is not enforced in the server logic but in the DB backend.

Change-Id: Iecbb096e0b7e080a3e0299ea340f8b03e87ddfd2
Closes-Bug: #1852777

commit_message:
Add more condition to check sg member exist

Only check sg object is not enough, we should also
check sg'ports is {} or not. Otherwise the old conjunction
will still exist.

Change-Id: I10588e73a9da7fdd43677f9247c176811dd68c62
Closes-Bug: #1854131
(cherry picked from commit 5cb0ff418a0794d060001a7313561c4cfb584d0e)

commit_message:
Ensure plugin path is correct

Updates the molecule plugin path for the ovs-dpdk and package
roles. This is done to ensure the role works in all molecule
based test environments when the test env rc file is sourced.

Change-Id: I4ccb230268b687fc546205af5c73c4a6fc110eae
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3186edf00087cf94787cc1e6613d349811a71b52)

[{'account_id': 30276, 'date': '2019-07-29 09:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-29 09:35:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-07-29 09:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 20:04:29.000000000', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp: cleanly ignore RTC route of unsupported type

When a BGP peer advertises an RTC route (RFC4684) with
a route target of a type bagpipe-bgp does not support, we
need to ignore these cleanly, and not break and reset the
BGP peering.

Note that it is safe to plainly ignore such routes because,
since bagpipe-bgp does not support them, it will never need
to propagate event for such RTs to a BGP peer.

Change-Id: Ie8d441b9d7669ec22236b2273d8e69a884751309
'}, {'created': '2019-11-18 09:37:18.000000000', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp: cleanly ignore RTC route of unsupported type

When a BGP peer advertises an RTC route (RFC4684) with
a route target of a type bagpipe-bgp does not support, we
need to ignore these cleanly, and not break and reset the
BGP peering.

Note that it is safe to plainly ignore such routes because,
since bagpipe-bgp does not support them, it will never need
to propagate event for such RTs to a BGP peer.

Change-Id: Ie8d441b9d7669ec22236b2273d8e69a884751309
(cherry picked from commit f4113085b069683f851e475c8bc738ce4d7478b2)
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: cleanly ignore RTC route of unsupported type

When a BGP peer advertises an RTC route (RFC4684) with
a route target of a type bagpipe-bgp does not support, we
need to ignore these cleanly, and not break and reset the
BGP peering.

Note that it is safe to plainly ignore such routes because,
since bagpipe-bgp does not support them, it will never need
to propagate event for such RTs to a BGP peer.

Change-Id: Ie8d441b9d7669ec22236b2273d8e69a884751309
(cherry picked from commit f4113085b069683f851e475c8bc738ce4d7478b2)

commit_message:
Change Upgrade Run Script Generation to Per Host

The previous method of upgrading the overcloud nodes was per role.
This patch updates the script generation to use a previously added
variable that stores the hosts.

Also, this patch provides the means to order the hosts by role
priority defined in the defaults.

Change-Id: I97d66073e3ab0011752c08fc8b7d488e19337dd4

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0. Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

commit_message:
Don't enable SSL on undercloud during upgrade.

SSL on undercloud is default in Rocky so new ssl cert is generated
during undercloud upgrade.
IMHO enabling ssl on undercloud should be requested explicitly.

Change-Id: Ib9cf9f6fbc8603835be196a78b322edc9ac6543c

commit_message:
Add timestamps to all log files

Confronting concurrent events on different logs during debug is
difficult without timestamps.
This adds timestamps to almost all the logs created in the role.

Change-Id: Ibf336c4ecbf09a46e382585303bbe734b5e0511c
Closes-Bug: #1760722

commit_message:
WIP: Add overcloud instance http check during upgrade

The scope of this test is to do a more realistic overcloud workload
check _during_ the upgrade process. This test queries the HTTP
server found at the first floating IP address and sets the maximum
time for this operation to 5s. After the upgrade step has finished
the test validates that there are no non-200 responses.

Change-Id: I1a291e61c22de56383483182fe56613ea114cf3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 14:12:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update base badges

Instead of displaying a "project official" badge which does not mean
much when you browse the project on opendev or GitHub, display an
"openstack community project" badge pointing to the project team list,
and a "cii best practices passing" badge pointing to our CII results.

Fix a bug that prevented badges with spaces from being properly
displayed.

Change-Id: I0be1fcc9c5553cc06891a593b253e3aee4e8ebb8
'}]
commit_message:
Update base badges

Instead of displaying a "project official" badge which does not mean
much when you browse the project on opendev or GitHub, display an
"openstack community project" badge pointing to the project team list,
and a "cii best practices passing" badge pointing to our CII results.

Fix a bug that prevented badges with spaces from being properly
displayed.

Change-Id: I0be1fcc9c5553cc06891a593b253e3aee4e8ebb8

Done'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-11-15 09:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-11-15 11:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I feel like the rename should depend on the governance change, rather than the other way around. That will allow to unblock this while we wait for the next rename window...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-11-15 12:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thierry, based on https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20190711-mandatory-repository-retirement.html - it will not be a rename but instead a retirement and create.

That can be done without a maintenance window.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from project-rename to project-update'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-11-15 15:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from project-update to neutron-interconnection-retire'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-11-15 16:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-11-15 16:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-11-15 17:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2019-11-16 15:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

As said on the mailing list:

I understand the need to adapt the project status to the lack of activity on the project in the past year.
During this time, my time as a reviewer, preventing the code submitted to be merged, has been taken by other activites (still OpenStack related!).

Having been at the origin of the project, I have to apologize for the lack of communication of where we were about this project.
My apologies for that.

We still would like to have a place to let the proposal exit, code be reviewed and tested.
Hosting under "x/" would work for us.

Hope that this can work like this...

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-11-16 16:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Retire neutron-interconnection from openstack/

Project neutron-interconnection was officialy in Neutron stadium but as
there was no activity on this project for quite long time and project
actually never got any real implementation done, during the Shanghai PTG
we decided to move it out of stadium to x/ namespace.

Also api-ref for this project is removed from neutron-lib with commit
[1].

Project rename patch is proposed at [2].

Patch which adds README file to the exising project is available at [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/694466/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/694478/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/694490/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694478/
Change-Id: I0200b500c4a89c6326d843b8628dfd87dc6eb778

commit_message:
Do not merge: test ara 1.0

There is no expectation that this will merge in it's current state.
This is only used to test the upcoming release of ara 1.0.

This is only being tested against Ubuntu right now since the new backend
is only compatible with py3 and we don't want to waste resources.

Change-Id: I2b10038ac23cdf791e2f45dbea71661378b71fe4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 14:12:06.000000000', 'message': 'Sort tag badges alphabetically

Rather than sorting badges by size, sort them alphabetically.

Since we can no longer rely on the last line having the largest badge,
change the column width calculation logic to actually look at all badges
in a column, rather than look at it from the bottom.

Change-Id: Ia116a46236ba2e8d8757d0191f0cf6432c81c600
'}]
commit_message:
Sort tag badges alphabetically

Rather than sorting badges by size, sort them alphabetically.

Since we can no longer rely on the last line having the largest badge,
change the column width calculation logic to actually look at all badges
in a column, rather than look at it from the bottom.

Change-Id: Ia116a46236ba2e8d8757d0191f0cf6432c81c600

commit_message:
Always place base badges first

The "project:official" badge is currently placed first because it
happens to be the smallest one. Separate base badges from tag badges
and always place them first.

Change-Id: I4a0e4ac277c3dfef52a7949c7143f16f4e08e48b

subject: Add healthcheck for nova-virtlogd container
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30133, 'name': 'Piotr Kopec', 'email': 'pkopec17@gmail.com', 'username': 'pkopec'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-11-11 10:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-11-12 09:08:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

nova-libvirt and nova-virtlogd use the same container image, so
we'd need to combine the virtlogd check in the nova-libvirt
check script, like we do for nova-api/nova-metadata. Since
libvirtd and virtlogd run privileged I think best is to pass
the process name to check as a parameter and then either run
the current libvirt check, or check the virtlogd pid.

Another maybe better/additional check for virtlogd is to check the 
virtlogd socket using healthcheck_socket from [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/healthcheck/common.sh#L63"}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-11-20 11:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-11-20 16:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-11-21 06:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-11-21 15:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-11-21 15:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-11-21 22:56:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-12-03 15:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit fd78d7181b13df6be393b1cd6a3149d406a654be'}]

commit_message:
Add healthcheck for nova-virtlogd container

Adds healthcheck for nova-virtlogd container by
checking whether /var/run/libvirt/virtlogd-sock
socket is opened or not in virtlogd container.

Change-Id: I9c76855169448a125541c94d480a4afd49ff6d0e

> Is it possible to have a failure such that VolumeDeviceNotFound is

The decorator wraps the underlying retrying module call and comes with defaults of 3 for retries and 1 for interval:

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/aed4ad4b09ba5699fa998e6ce3eab4e4c7afddf8/os_brick/utils.py#L32-L65'}, {'account_id': 9236, 'date': '2019-11-26 16:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(7 comments)

As discussed on IRC, I would really like Nova to be able to update the BDM after the encryption, that way os-brick could return a real path on attach, and then when doing encryption it could return a different path with the unencrypted dm.  'that way we wouldn't need to return a symlink in the first place.

Thank you for adding those nice tests.  I think we need to count the number of calls though."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-11-29 13:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27710, 'date': '2019-11-29 14:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I'm OK with this as a temporary solution (that has the advantage of being backportable) until we either fix the Nova flow to work with real paths (work that you have already started) or we start using our own symlinks so we don't have to wait for the ones created by the udev rules."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-03 13:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks sane to me.


 > I'm OK with this as a temporary solution (that has the advantage of
 > being backportable) until we either fix the Nova flow to work with
 > real paths (work that you have already started) or we start using
 > our own symlinks so we don't have to wait for the ones created by
 > the udev rules.

Makes me wonder - what would non-Nova consumers expect to have here? This is a separate discussion probably, but I think we need to make sure the contract that os-brick adheres to makes sense for any consumer of the lib."}]

[{'created': '2019-11-21 20:05:16.000000000', 'message': 'WIP iscsi: Add retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Failures currently seen in CI suggest that some nodes are struggling to
populate this in time resulting in a complete retry of
_connect_single_volume. We should instead just retry looking for the
symlink to hopefully give udev enough time to populate.

Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474
Closes-Bug: #1820007
'}, {'created': '2019-11-22 10:05:37.000000000', 'message': 'iscsi: Add _get_device_link retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Bug #1820007 documents failures to find /dev/disk/by-id/ symlinks
associated with encrypted volumes both in real world and CI
environments. These failures appear to be due to udev on these slow or
overloaded hosts failing to populate the required /dev/disk/by-id/
symlinks in time after the iSCSI volume has been connected.

This change seeks to avoid such failures by simply decorating
_get_device_link with the @utils.retry to hopefully allow udev time to
create the required symlinks under /dev/disk/by-id/.

Closes-Bug: #1820007
Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474

commit_message:
iscsi: Add _get_device_link retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Bug #1820007 documents failures to find /dev/disk/by-id/ symlinks
associated with encrypted volumes both in real world and CI
environments. These failures appear to be due to udev on these slow or
overloaded hosts failing to populate the required /dev/disk/by-id/
symlinks in time after the iSCSI volume has been connected.

This change seeks to avoid such failures by simply decorating
_get_device_link with the @utils.retry to hopefully allow udev time to
create the required symlinks under /dev/disk/by-id/.

Closes-Bug: #1820007
Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474

commit_message:
Clean up badge generation code

Before making deeper changes, clean up existing code by:

- introducing variables controlling number of columns, and spacing
  between badges
- renaming confusing function names and variables
- adding a few comments
- wrapping long lines

Change-Id: I79fccd1221274bf6aa96f6c4c7404ebe10545660

[{'created': '2019-11-15 05:33:26.000000000', 'message': "Use ovn-ctl script to start OVN ovsdb-servers

Using the ovn-ctl script to start the OVN ovsdb-server is the better
way. This script is used to start and stop all OVN systemd services.
This script takes care of creating the database from the schema,
updating the database from the schema when the schema version gets
updated.

The present scripts - start_nb_db_server.sh and start_sb_db_server.sh
doesn't take care of schema updates.

With this, we don't need extend_start.sh in ovn-nb-db-server/ovn-sb-db-server
to create the database from the schema.

This patch also deletes kolla_ovn_extend_start from the ovn-base image as it
is not required.

Closes-bug: 1850025
Change-Id: I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb
(cherry picked from commit b8c8fa15edcf5336a1121155cdc880a35ccf161f)
"}]
commit_message:
Use ovn-ctl script to start OVN ovsdb-servers

Using the ovn-ctl script to start the OVN ovsdb-server is the better
way. This script is used to start and stop all OVN systemd services.
This script takes care of creating the database from the schema,
updating the database from the schema when the schema version gets
updated.

The present scripts - start_nb_db_server.sh and start_sb_db_server.sh
doesn't take care of schema updates.

With this, we don't need extend_start.sh in ovn-nb-db-server/ovn-sb-db-server
to create the database from the schema.

This patch also deletes kolla_ovn_extend_start from the ovn-base image as it
is not required.

Closes-bug: 1850025
Change-Id: I31a372d801dace92950cd85b29b308431f78bbdb
(cherry picked from commit b8c8fa15edcf5336a1121155cdc880a35ccf161f)

commit_message:
Fill sslProfile only when it is defined

Currently when it is not defined the config contains sslProfile: undef which
makes nterior QDR communication malf`unctioning.

commit_message:
Synchronize connection configuration for metrics

Currently there are cases when collectd is trying to connect to QDR
on different interface than QDR is listening for connections.

This patch makes sure that those services are always in sync. And also
is changing interior configuration to work based on IPs instead
of hostnames.

Change-Id: Ia865bef9daf5b7e92b1b8c3712113416c9c8c176

commit_message:
Split QDR environment from collectd

This patch splits QDR configuration from shared environment files which enables
flexibility to either run in edge mode only or in mesh mode.

It also adds separate environment file for ceilometer and dynamic listener
configuration for storage nodes for cases when storage nodes are not connected
to internal network (which is a case for CephStorage nodes by default).

Change-Id: I6b5af0b5afcdec75fe239385922dc84fbbb8288c

commit_message:
use objects common_types from neutron-lib

This patch consumes the neutron-lib OVO common_types module by
removing it from neutron and switching imports over to use neutron-lib
instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ic9819a27e3e72038b819ab2fe845c26fc63b26d5

subject: Networking-ovn final release
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-12-02 09:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-02 10:02:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This does not match the release model (cycle-with-rc). If we want to do such an early release in the Ussuri cycle we'll have to switch to cycle-with-intermediary.

But if in Ussuri's final release, networking-ovn will be merged within Neutron, I fear it would be confusing to have an ussuri networking-ovn 8.0.0 release in addition to it...

I understand the idea behind doing a last release before merging though... Maybe it would make more sense as a stable/train release?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-02 10:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-02 10:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-02 10:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-02 11:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

That is the right thing to do, but it is too much of a corner case for our automation to be happy with it.

I propose we push a "before-merge" tag manually and remove the ussuri file. How does that sound?'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-12-02 11:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> That is the right thing to do, but it is too much of a corner case
 > for our automation to be happy with it.
 > 
 > I propose we push a "before-merge" tag manually and remove the
 > ussuri file. How does that sound?

Thanks Slawek, Thierry for the latest updates!

The manual push sounds good to me. I just do not know how we can proceed with it tho'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-02 11:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Release managers can do it once we get some consensus among us that this is the right path.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-02 11:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Release managers can do it once we get some consensus among us that
 > this is the right path.

Thx, that sounds for me as the best possible solution for that'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-03 14:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The tag was manually pushed as neutron-merge'}]

commit_message:
Networking-ovn final release

The networking-ovn project code is now being merged into the Neutron
repository as part of this effort: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658414/

All the required patches for a final release of networking-ovn is being
merged and the repository is now frozen.

This this patche is release the latest version (8.0.0) of
networking-ovn.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ovn-merge
Change-Id: Id9bad7156ba308de20dfe839504b7b10d4b32953
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add relnote on swift-proxy and policy.d overrides

Essentially, add a note that says: it's not implemented on Swift because
it doesn't really fit the model.  However, glance and cinder both have
support for policy.d overrides so it doesn't really matter.

Change-Id: I62b5c24d33b34493553687f691fa4fa42c99ac31

This logic gets triggered in the metalsmith job, breaking it :(

https://06f9bb1494678e09516b-218375fc8749de6a1ac263f444b96da4.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/679333/7/check/metalsmith-integration-ipa-src/8ec1a2c/controller/ironic-bm-logs/node-0_no_ansi_2019-09-04-17:18:50.log'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-09-20 01:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-09-20 01:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-09-20 09:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

My comment holds: this logic is incorrect, it breaks local boot with partition images.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-09-21 14:46:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> My comment holds: this logic is incorrect, it breaks local boot
 > with partition images.

We have so many bugs centered around booting. without the current depends-on, bootdev was being set to network, which is partially why this was failing. It was going to reboot and nothing was happening. Now.... I'm not sure of the failure, but I need to dig further to determine it."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-10-11 21:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-10-14 12:20:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

From what i see, this will break installations on software RAID devices: the 'device' the patch is checking is the md device. It will have a bootloader (which came with the whole disk image), but it is not the one relevant (which is the one on the holder disks)."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-10-14 20:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-10-15 15:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-10-16 09:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Don't try to put a bootloader in place when bootable

Lets not do silly things and if the disk looks bootable,
and we're not trying to do UEFI, then let us assume the
proper thing will occur upon power-up.

Looks at the boot sector data and if an executable is
found in the first 218 bytes, then it bypasses loading
a boot loader.

Also adds a dependency on the "file" linux distribution
package.

Change-Id: I11bc26670a08ee13174a43d7cd0f1ab9c1bd35cf
Story: 2006474
Task: 36410

commit_message:
Rename baremetal-introspection playbook

This change renames our workflow playbook to have the prefix
"cli-". This is being done so that we can easily identify
playbooks that are used in the cli client.

Change-Id: Iec36e5e20f4aae1d72e2ded2012ed365d44df7eb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Baremetal Introspection Playbook

This Ansible playbook provides a way of running a set of Ironic nodes through
introspection. It is intended to be used by the `openstack overcloud node
introspect` CLI command.

Related-Bug: #1835230
Co-Author: Sagi Shnaidman <sshnaidm@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iebfd92461f4132f148ac2d935b58d06e1f1ff3c8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 30974, 'date': '2019-09-16 10:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-09-16 10:45:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2019-09-16 11:26:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-09-16 13:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The approach of creating volumes slightly larger is interesting, but we need to look at it more broadly as well -- what happens if you create a slightly larger than 1GB volume on LVM and then try to migrate it to a 1GB volume on another backend?

Will that not be possible due to the size difference?

Need to understand all the implications involved in this change.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2019-09-16 14:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Cinder Windows CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Cinder Windows CI

- cinder-iscsi http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/682339/1/iscsi/ : FAILURE in 3h 40m 34s
- cinder-smb http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/682339/1/smb/ : FAILURE in 3h 05m 05s'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-09-16 19:10:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Something like this must happen on other drivers too, how do they handle this?'}, {'account_id': 30974, 'date': '2019-09-18 05:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30974, 'date': '2019-09-18 05:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 10:45:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix openstack cinder bug

Patch to avoid the out of space issue when migrating encrypted
volume between two LVM backends

Migration of encrypted volumes or retyping to encrypted volumes causes
an outofspace issue. This process has dd copy command which assumes
that the size of the source volume to copy is SIZE OF THE VOLUME and
creates an equivalent destination volume. This works fine for normal
cases but when encryption occurs, a 2 MB encryption header is added to
the Source volume making it's size to be SIZE OF THE VOLUME+ 2MB.
As a result, dd command is interrupted with a NO SPACE LEFT ON DEVICE
error. This patch creates a destination volume with a size
of SIZE OF THE VOLUME+ 2MB ONLY when migration or retyping of encrypted
volumes occurs thereby completely fixing the issue.

Change-Id: I3c70a870b485828caf7784a027fd4dbff6c47943
Closes-Bug: #1720885
Closes-Bug: #1824321

commit_message:
Avoiding out of space issue in LVM when migrating encrypted volumes

Patch to avoid the out of space issue when migrating encrypted
volume between two LVM backends

Migration of encrypted volumes or retyping to encrypted volumes causes
an outofspace issue. This process has dd copy command which assumes
that the size of the source volume to copy is SIZE OF THE VOLUME and
creates an equivalent destination volume. This works fine for normal
cases but when encryption occurs, a 2 MB encryption header is added to
the Source volume making it's size to be SIZE OF THE VOLUME+ 2MB.
As a result, dd command is interrupted with a NO SPACE LEFT ON DEVICE
error. This patch creates a destination volume with a size
of SIZE OF THE VOLUME+ 2MB ONLY when migration or retyping of encrypted
volumes occurs thereby completely fixing the issue.

Change-Id: I3c70a870b485828caf7784a027fd4dbff6c47943
Closes-Bug: #1720885
Closes-Bug: #1824321

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 19:20:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add migration for creating default volume type

The patch adds the following functionality:
A default volume type will be created during cinder deployment.
Admins can override the default type in cinder.conf
If no default type is specified in cinder.conf then default
volume type is used.
The default volume type cannot be deleted (so creating untyped
volumes is not possible)

Change-Id: I4da0c13b5b3f8174a30b8557f968d6b9e641b091
Partial-Implements: blueprint untyped-volumes-default-volume-type
'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 04:01:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add migration for creating default volume type

Change-Id: I4da0c13b5b3f8174a30b8557f968d6b9e641b091
Partial-Implements: blueprint untyped-volumes-default-volume-type
'}, {'created': '2019-04-17 11:04:24.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add migrations for default volume type

The patch adds the following functionality:
A default volume type will be created during cinder DB migration.
Admins can override the default type in cinder.conf
The default value for 'default_volume_type' config will be set
as 'default_vol_type'
The default volume type cannot be deleted (so creating untyped
volumes is not possible)
Adding online migrations to set volume type of all untyped volumes
and snapshots to default_vol_type

Change-Id: I4da0c13b5b3f8174a30b8557f968d6b9e641b091
Partial-Implements: blueprint untyped-volumes-default-volume-type
"}, {'created': '2019-04-24 10:26:29.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add migrations for default volume type

commit_message:
Untyped to Default Volume Type

The patch adds the following functionality:
* A default volume type (``__DEFAULT__``) will be
  created during cinder DB migration.
* Admins can override the default type in cinder.conf
* Creating a new volume without any type (and
  `default_volume_type` option is unset in cinder.conf)
  will be assigned the ``__DEFAULT__`` type.
* The default volume type cannot be deleted
* All untyped volumes and snapshots will be migrated to the
  ``__DEFAULT__`` type.

Change-Id: I4da0c13b5b3f8174a30b8557f968d6b9e641b091
Implements: blueprint untyped-volumes-default-volume-type

commit_message:
NEC Driver: Support revert to snapshot

Adding support to revert a volume to a snapshot in NEC driver.
This patch implements revert_to_snapshot().

This patch also deletes unused classes(class UnpairWaitForBackup,
class UnpairWaitForDDRBackup).

Change-Id: I1bf5bd3856009e92921cbbd7f91734e070d5e86f

commit_message:
Move the constants to constants.py (for Fujitsu driver)

In order to avoid a single giant commit, we will submit the community
code step by step.
Step1：Move the constants to constants.py.

Change-Id: Ibcd383e5ce559a4ae926e7e8f429bab3caa3ed0d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-19 21:07:41.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Add tests to illustrate the stale image metadata situation.

Moves the problematic code to a private function so it's easier
to test, and adds 'test_merge_volume_image_meta' which fails and
illustrates the bug.

Closes-bug: #1844725

commit_message:
Make sure stale image metadata is not used

When uploading a volume to an image, Cinder checks to see if there's
any image metadata already present on the volume, and if so, it adds
it to the image-create request so that Glance will persist these
additional properties on the new image.  If during upload preparation,
Cinder wants to add specific metadata to the new image (for example,
a new encryption key id), we need to ensure that the new value for
this property is preferred to a value in the volume_glance_metadata
table.

Closes-bug: #1844725

Change-Id: Iba3c5fa4db87641a84eb22a0fc93294dd55a3132

subject: Add "deletion policy" property to uploaded images

commit_message:
Add "deletion policy" property to uploaded images

Commit b190a39a to Glance (included in Train M-3) introduces a
optional 'cinder_encryption_key_deletion_policy' image property
that will cause Glance to attempt to delete the Barbican secret
whose id is the value of the 'cinder_encryption_key_id' image
property when such an image is deleted, as long as the value of
the deletion policy property is 'on_image_deletion'.  So let's
take advantage of that.

Change-Id: Id75d00f556466c15cd67cfc6e140cebd121959b9

[{'created': '2019-08-09 13:59:35.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Fix replication

Replication on SolidFire does not work. This patch address several of
the problems currently found in this driver:

 - When creating a SolidFire volume with a volume type that has
replication enabled the replication_status of this volume was not
changing.
 - During initialization, if a cluster is already paired, the driver
does not load.
 - Driver does not create volumes on the replication target on
several configurations. For example, if the volume is being
created from a snashot or from another volume, etc.

Closes-bug: #1834013
Change-Id: I920f958db1d48e52b548082d852c03f427a279ca
