This patch addresses several of the problems currently found in this
driver:

 - When creating a SolidFire volume with a volume type that has
replication enabled the replication_status of this volume was not
changing.
 - During initialization, if a cluster is already paired, the driver
fails to load.
 - Driver does not create volumes on the replication target on
several configurations. For example, if the volume is being
created from a snashot or from another volume, etc.
 - During Failback, the driver doesn't update iSCSI connection
info to the secondary cluster nor the volume's replication status.

Closes-bug: #1834013

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix replication

This patch addresses several of the problems currently found in this
driver:

 - When creating a SolidFire volume with a volume type that has
replication enabled the replication_status of this volume was not
changing.
 - During initialization, if a cluster is already paired, the driver
fails to load.
 - Driver does not create volumes on the replication target on
several configurations. For example, if the volume is being
created from a snashot or from another volume, etc.
 - During Failback, the driver doesn't update iSCSI connection
info to the secondary cluster nor the volume's replication status.

Closes-bug: #1834013
Closes-bug: #1751932
Change-Id: I920f958db1d48e52b548082d852c03f427a279ca
Co-Authored-By: Fernando Ferraz <sfernand@netapp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Correa <thiago.correa@netapp.com>

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Debug Metadata Fix

This submission addressess an issue whereby service level was
not returned on occassion, service level and workload are now
returned for all volumes in the metadata tables when debug
mode is enabled. The compression attribute has also been
standardised to bring it in line with metadata set on
volumes. Both places now have the attribute 'compression
disabled'.

Change-Id: I04d20c0c59f8269663fb829319bea1087619d2e2

Is there any update for support matrix?
Do we want to bump the driver version for it?
Or at least bump the version that contains this and consistency group support.'}, {'account_id': 18742, 'date': '2019-02-18 03:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18742, 'date': '2019-02-18 03:19:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Is there any update for support matrix?
 > Do we want to bump the driver version for it?
 > Or at least bump the version that contains this and consistency
 > group support.

Yes, support matrix is updated from patch 4.

I just bump the version to the same one of CG currently. Because we don't know which one (replication or cg) would be merged first, so we cannot set the version of cg to 5.0 and the version of replication to 5.1 for example. If replication review was merged first and then cg, the change history would be strange like:
  4.0 - ......
  5.1 - replication support
  5.0 - cg support

So, my solution here is setting the same version first. Whichever of cg or replication is merged first will get version of 5.0. Then the other review will be merge-conflict, I'll update it to version 5.1."}, {'account_id': 20284, 'date': '2019-02-18 03:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Unity: Add replication support

Add volume replication support for Dell EMC Unity driver.

Implements: blueprint unity-replication-support

Change-Id: I595b8017cb8116ff7e713692afdd92a11134066f

Formatting problem noted inline.

Not everyone knows this, but when zuul runs the openstack-tox-docs job, it creates a preview website where you can see the HTML generated from your patch.  To get there, click on the 'openstack-tox-docs' link in the "Zuul check" table, and it will take you to a "Zuul Build" page.  About halfway down the page is an "Artifacts" section; click on the 'Docs preview site' link.  That way you can make sure your change is going to render correctly in HTML.'}, {'account_id': 29716, 'date': '2019-09-20 05:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Delete unused key when rekeying volume

The new volume's encryption key that was cloned
earlier in the volume creation process should be
delete after rekey succeeds, because it is no
longer used.

Change-Id: I243d1b47f3996ccdda977ef21b979fd3fc49a2f9
Closes-Bug: #1844556

subject: Leverage hw accelerator in image compression

(2 comments)

A typo and clarification suggestion noted inline.

> I wonder if we should mention about the hardware and software requirements in commit message or releasenote to use QAT accelerator.

We can see what other people think about this.  My suggestion would be to include that info in the new doc page and then we can update this releas enote with the URL.  The reason I don't think we need to lay that out here is that we're shipping with this feature "off".  One thing that occurs to me is that you're using the external 'gzip' tool (instead of the python language bindings), which I think is ok because it gives a symmetry with the way you have to use qzip, but it does mean that the gzip tool, like qzip, will have to be available to the Cinder user in order to perform the compression.  But I think this can be covered in the doc, it doesn't have to be mentioned in the "issues" section of the release note.  (But other reviewers may feel differently.)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-09-17 15:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)

AccelGZIP and AccelQAT classes have very similar code and it should be refactored. TBH, I don't want to block this patch at this moment, so I won't +1 or -1 on it"}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-09-19 00:38:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > AccelGZIP and AccelQAT classes have very similar code and it should
 > be refactored. 

Let me explain it. We're considering this and we think it's better not to refactor. Since QAT and GZIP are totally different accelerator, they 'may' have different workflow (but they're nearly the same in code).

If there are other accelerator with different workflow, I think they maybe not able to use the refactored base class.

BUT, the code looks really similar. Looking forward to a good way to address it.

 >TBH, I don't want to block this patch at this
 > moment, so I won't +1 or -1 on it

Thanks you!"}, {'account_id': 29716, 'date': '2019-09-19 05:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Build Successful. 

* linstor_ci http://us.linbit.com:8080/CI-LINSTOR/25/2782 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-19 13:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+2

I do think some refactoring of common code could still be done, and because something in the future potentially could be different, isn't a reason not to do that now.

"Now" as in sometime soon in a follow up patch, not "now" as in this patch shouldn't be merged based on that.

This looks good to me. I will wait to approve a bit just in case anyone else has some comments.'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-09-19 13:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-03 08:34:10.000000000', 'message': "Leverage hw accelerator in image compression

When trying to upload volume to glance as image, currently all the format
transformation is done by software and the performance is not good.

Leverage hardware accelerator to do the image conversion, so as to offload CPU,
release CPU to do more common and complex thing. Professional hardware
accelerator will get better performance and shorter conversion time than
software solution. Currently hardware accelerator is getting more popular and
some are integrated in server chipset by default.

This patch includes:

1. Introduced a new type of image format - 'gzip' which can be supported by
most of the hw accelerators.

2. Implemented a simple framework: if there's an accelerator detected in
system, then try to use it.

3. Supported Intel QAT as one of the accelerator

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652275/
Change-Id: I8460f58d2ad95a6654cf4d6a6bb367f3c537536b
Implements: blueprint leverage-compression-accelerator
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-31 09:36:55.000000000', 'message': "Leverage hw accelerator in image compression

accelerator will get better performance and shorter conversion time than
software solution. Currently hardware accelerator is getting more popular and
some are integrated in server chipset by default.

This patch includes:

1. Introduced a new type of image format - 'gzip' which can be supported by
most of the hw accelerators.

2. Implemented a simple framework: if there's an accelerator detected in
system, then try to use it.

3. Supported Intel QAT as one of the accelerator

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652275/
Change-Id: I8460f58d2ad95a6654cf4d6a6bb367f3c537536b
Implements: blueprint leverage-compression-accelerator
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 03:19:11.000000000', 'message': "Leverage hw accelerator in image compression

When trying to upload volume to glance as image, currently all the format
transformation is done by software and the performance is not good.

Leverage hardware accelerator to do the image conversion, so as to offload CPU,
release CPU to do more common and complex thing. Professional hardware
accelerator will get better performance and shorter conversion time than
software solution. Currently hardware accelerator is getting more popular and
some are integrated in server chipset by default.

This patch includes:

1. Introduced a new type of image format - 'gzip' which can be supported by
most of the hw accelerators.

2. Implemented a simple framework: if there's an accelerator detected in
system, then try to use it.

3. Supported Intel QAT as one of the accelerator

4. Software accelerator 'gzip' fallback if hardware accelerator is not
available, which in this patch is the Intel QAT.

5. Add command filter for command 'qzip' and 'gzip' in rootwrap.

6. Unit tests for accelerators.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652275/
Change-Id: I8460f58d2ad95a6654cf4d6a6bb367f3c537536b
Implements: blueprint leverage-compression-accelerator
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-07 15:33:19.000000000', 'message': "Leverage hw accelerator in image compression

commit_message:
Leverage hw accelerator in image compression

When trying to upload volume to glance as image, currently all the
format transformation is done by software and the performance is not
good.

Leverage hardware accelerator to do the image compression, so as to
offload CPU, release CPU to do more common and complex thing.
Professional hardware accelerator will get better performance and
shorter conversion time than software solution. Currently hardware
accelerator is getting more popular and some are integrated in server
chipset by default.

This patch includes:

1. Uses the new image container_format 'compressed' introduced by Glance
in the Train release

2. Implemented a simple framework: if there's an accelerator detected in
system, then try to use it

3. Supported Intel QAT as one of the accelerator

4. Add command filter for command 'qzip' and 'gzip' in rootwrap

5. New configuration option 'allow_compression_on_image_upload' and
'compression_format' added

6. Releasenote added

Change-Id: I8460f58d2ad95a6654cf4d6a6bb367f3c537536b
Implements: blueprint leverage-compression-accelerator
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
PowerMax Docs -  Short host and port group name changes

Clarify in the PowerMax naming conventions section that if the short host
exceeds 16 characters and the port group exceeds 12 characters,
then they must be shortened and still remain unique.
This is because these names are used in the creation of storage groups
and masking view names which are limited to 64 characters.

Change-Id: I61735e689baf407df17c6cc563a199b2cb0055e0

commit_message:
Add timeout when querying agent's command statuses

Otherwise the node can get locked up for a significant amount of time.
It conforms to the behaviour of all other (POST) HTTP requests done to
agent.

Story: 2006946
Task: 37626
Change-Id: I968606a300bc43675d7bd07f73de37967ef80c26
(cherry picked from commit 33a84d94eb4d495312e3ba750b194213737a8933)

[{'created': '2019-12-02 15:21:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sed in run-os-net-config to only replace values, not keys

The sed in run-os-net-config.sh replaces all instances of bridge_name
but it should only replace values, not keys.

Closes-bug: #1854780
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sed in run-os-net-config to only replace values, not keys

The sed in run-os-net-config.sh replaces all instances of bridge_name
but it should only replace values, not keys.

Change-Id: Iaf19e1550bd7a5286b8512596efd84cf14c78f32
Closes-bug: #1854780

commit_message:
Fix host kernel modules when using linux-hwe on ubuntu

Currently on ubuntu 18.04 there is new linux-hwe kernel that uses linux 5.0
In newer versions nf_conntrack_ipv4 and nf_conntrack_ipv6 was merged into
nf_conntrack.

This fixes setup hosts playbook on systems that use linux-hwe

Change-Id: I47defcb18ac6b6059e22cd294e9461b69f015471
(cherry picked from commit 78db2a57da6a2aea9345fee1cea3a9915c2e65e5)

commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I4795417aa649be75ba7162a8cf30eacbb88c7b5e

commit_message:
Create a job with boot and networking managed by ironic

The devstack plugin is updated to skip configuring PXE environment
if managed mode is requested, so that only ironic's PXE environment
is usable.

Change-Id: Ib7b83210a02b727d94dfa15bde43e7fee2e51531
Story: #1528920
Task: #37254

commit_message:
Fix the hieradata_override template

Currently when we generate hieradata_override
with glance_backend: file, the file is not
formed correctly.

Change-Id: I2dea3ce979c3b2d01dc15dd63635efdc1378c15d

subject: Do not remove rhos-release if running leapp unsubscribed.
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-11-27 07:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/train.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-12-03 10:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-12-03 10:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-27 07:10:10.000000000', 'message': "Do not remove rhos-release if running leapp unsubscribed.

The option leapp_unsubscribed allows us to run the Leapp
upgrade without need of a subscription (relies on external
workarounds and hacks). As it uses rhos-release underneath
to provide with the RHEL8 repos, we can't get rid of rhos-
release as we were doing when the node was subscribed.

Change-Id: I08abf241ee742622593e5c841db127fcf78c3d13
(cherry picked from commit b66686c706f1beb93d07e7ae929dc844fa2948af)
(cherry picked from commit f7f709db298ddd75636f5d10b33d4b6af3e5af4e)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not remove rhos-release if running leapp unsubscribed.

The option leapp_unsubscribed allows us to run the Leapp
upgrade without need of a subscription (relies on external
workarounds and hacks). As it uses rhos-release underneath
to provide with the RHEL8 repos, we can't get rid of rhos-
release as we were doing when the node was subscribed.

Change-Id: I08abf241ee742622593e5c841db127fcf78c3d13
(cherry picked from commit b66686c706f1beb93d07e7ae929dc844fa2948af)
(cherry picked from commit f7f709db298ddd75636f5d10b33d4b6af3e5af4e)

commit_message:
Fix indentation for the rendered launcher-playbook

Fix badly formatted job vars placement, e.g.:

      - job:
          name: foo-dlrn-hash-tag
          parent: foo
          vars:
            mirror_fqdn: {{ mirror_path }}
            ready_releases_file: |
              #!/bin/env bash
              export STANDALONE_TARGET_HASH="bar"

                        registry_login_enabled: false

Change-Id: I80d06cb66bdc725b70ecb5ef938026a36e793dcf
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure plugin path is correct

Updates the molecule plugin path for the ovs-dpdk and package
roles. This is done to ensure the role works in all molecule
based test environments when the test env rc file is sourced.

Change-Id: I4ccb230268b687fc546205af5c73c4a6fc110eae
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-02 16:49:58.000000000', 'message': "Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: Iff319bfedc2c20c139419bb625aa5de83de93538
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: Iff319bfedc2c20c139419bb625aa5de83de93538

[{'account_id': 28744, 'date': '2018-07-24 08:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-24 08:46:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-08-01 11:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This change looks pretty great and it implements useful functionality.

In addition to the in-line comments, there are no unit nor functional tests.

Tests serve two purposes; they demonstrate to you and to a reviewer that your code does what you think it does right now, and it is the only way to make sure that the code keeps doing what it needs to do to retain the functionality as the code is further developed, changed and maintained by many hands over the course of time.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-07 11:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this review as abandoned due to lack of activity in the past 6 months.

commit_message:
Add custom_properties config option

This change add "custom_properties" configuration option which
allows custom image properties to be added to glance.

Change-Id: I32d97c9f8026ac1aa16a2bc6cd134f26860c59b2
Closes-Bug: #1783125

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-18 12:32:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add upgrade check for NIC Switch agent

This commit adds an upgrade check for NIC switch agent
alerting operators to ensure relevant hosts have kernel > 3.13.

This check is introduced due to recent cleanup in NIC switch
agent code.

As of U release, Supported CentOS major was updated to 8 so it
is not expected that any deployment will have hosts running
kernel <= 3.13 since, however this is added as an extra precaution.

This check should be removed in 1-2 cycles. A TODO was added to
reflect that.

Change-Id: I34003b3c2f0ac23185d036c9e47dc1c8662d6ce7
Related-bug: #1841067
'}, {'created': '2019-11-18 18:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add upgrade check for NIC Switch agent

This check should be removed in 1-2 cycles. A TODO was added to

commit_message:
Add upgrade check for NIC Switch agent

This commit adds an upgrade check for NIC switch agent
alerting operators to ensure relevant hosts have kernel >= 3.13.

This check is introduced due to recent cleanup in NIC switch
agent code.

As of U release, Supported CentOS major was updated to 8 so it
is not expected that any deployment will have hosts running
kernel < 3.13. This check is added as an extra precaution.

This check should be removed in 1-2 cycles. A TODO was added to
reflect that.

Change-Id: I34003b3c2f0ac23185d036c9e47dc1c8662d6ce7
Related-bug: #1841067

commit_message:
Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.FullLoader

Because we don't need to use yaml.FullLoader, use yaml.SafeLoder
so that we can keep compability with PyYAML < 5.1 .

Change-Id: I51e700f5ad3364c5c8a26aa79b44cd8da1ec469d

commit_message:
Provide the real path of device for ceph to prepare

This is a followup patch for the previous commits that are
addressing issues with bcache based configuration.

Providing dname path for ceph-disk is unsafe, the prepare command
uses gdisk which breaks the dname symlinks.

Change-Id: I022ee079fe75d0a113ac2a6dd25f84a9d8fe4e55
Closes-Bug: 1790186
Signed-off-by: Gabor Meszaros <gabor.meszaros@canonical.com>

commit_message:
iptables save fix for centos 7

Centos 7 use systemd, we cannot use service save iptables anymore.
iptables can be stopped and disabled so we just save rules in
/etc/sysconfig/iptables with iptables-save

Change-Id: I55342afadea29a1a07fe50f30e0371b3367c3d7a
Closes-Bug: 1831175

subject: Run rootwrap with lower fd ulimit by default
messages:
[{'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-25 17:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-26 05:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-10-26 08:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Although this is mostly backward-compatible, this is still a behavior change in (admittedly-odd) corner cases, introducing a new config option to tune it. So that would require an exception to the stable policy (basically performance would need to be so bad and this would have to be the only solution around it)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 13:49:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This has a new configuration option, which doesn't make it a good candidate for a backport, especially if the default behavior is changed."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-11-12 18:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry I did not realize the config change.
Let me abandon this patch.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-11-13 00:00:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We can make it stable policy compliant with a small change. Still think it's worth backporting"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This introduces a new config option, but by default the behavior should not change. We have granted exceptions for that kind of changes in stable branches in the past in extreme cases (security issues, extremely bad performance issues)...

This is clearly in grey area and I'd like to get oslo-core and stable-maint-core's opinion on it."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-12-23 23:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This is clearly a feature but it is one we need to mitigate a performance regression  introduced by the kernel's spectre mitigation[1].

The performance number look compelling but they're also incomplete wouldn't using daemon mode (without code changes give the same benefit?)

Releasing this would mean that oslo.rootwrap should get a minor semver bump, but it can't as that version is already taken :(  In general I'm okay with this.  I am going to leave a -1 until we can verify that this hasn't introduced a security problem on master that we're backporting to stable

[1] with pretty much means it will be/has been backported to every kernel we care about"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-01-02 14:50:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-01-02 15:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Run rootwrap with lower fd ulimit by default

On Python 2.x, a subprocess.Popen() with close_fds=True will
fork and then close filedescriptors range(3..os.sysconf("SC_OPEN_MAX")),
which thanks to Kernel PTI (Kaiser patches) is significantly slower
in 2018 when the range is very large. With a soft limit of 1048576,
benchmark.py reports an overhead of ~ 400ms without this patch and 2ms
with the patch applied. This patch adds a configuration option and
leaves it disabled for the stable/* backports to not change default
behavior.

Also includes Ben Nemec's release note entry, adjusted for the stable
backport. This is Ib29e96307caa39c21936f216d9aed7907e7a7331 for master.

Also includes I2391315f77718a3c9eb9fc8c03a6882237f33548 from master.

Also includes I3b481ddd14ae2b948270d715aad157cf3996def7 from master.

(cherry picked from commit c0a86998203315858721a7b2c8ab75fbf5cd51d9)
(cherry picked from commit 8f148f5e9e786d8a3922b0d5ae29bc54b8e8e1e9)
(cherry picked from commit 5259c08c09eb3aeab64af928cddf84bc213594d3)

Closes-Bug: 1796267
Closes-Bug: #1804639
Change-Id: Idd98c183eca3e2df8648fc0f37d27fe9cc6d0563

commit_message:
Use <project>_install_type instead of kolla_install_type

Use <project>_install_type instead of kolla_install_type
to set python_path. For example, general kolla_install_type
is 'binary', but user wants to deploy Horizon from 'source'.
Horizon templates still use python_path=/usr/share/openstack-dashboard,
it is wrong.

Conflicts:
	ansible/roles/gnocchi/templates/wsgi-gnocchi.conf.j2

Change-Id: Ide6a24e17b1f8ab6506aa5e53f70693706830418
Closes-Bug: #1854735
(cherry picked from commit 043943117d2e10d787da1db7e87cd69852fc6cd2)

commit_message:
[Train] Fix Tacker config for the local Glance store

It turned out the previous fix ([1]) was incomplete.
Additionally, it seems we have to limit Tacker server
to one instance co-located with conductor.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/684275
commit b96ade3cf01009d822f85744efee523127f2674c

Change-Id: I9ce27d5f68f32ef59e245960e23336ae5c5db905
Closes-bug: #1853715
Related-bug: #1845142

commit_message:
use python 2.7 for pep8 venv

This seems required to avoid issues such as the following
which started to popup when py3 became the default:

  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/builder.py", line 134, in file_build
    module = self._data_build(data, modname, path)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/builder.py", line 177, in _data_build
    module = rebuilder.visit_module(node, modname, node_file, package)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 148, in visit_module
    newnode.body = [self.visit(child, newnode) for child in node.body]
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 148, in <listcomp>
    newnode.body = [self.visit(child, newnode) for child in node.body]
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 161, in visit
    return self._transform(visit_method(node, parent))
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 238, in visit_assign
    newnode.value = self.visit(node.value, newnode)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 161, in visit
    return self._transform(visit_method(node, parent))
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 329, in visit_callfunc
    newnode.func = self.visit(node.func, newnode)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 161, in visit
    return self._transform(visit_method(node, parent))
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 551, in visit_getattr
    newnode.expr = self.visit(node.value, newnode)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 161, in visit
    return self._transform(visit_method(node, parent))
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/.tox/pep8/lib/python3.6/site-packages/astroid/rebuilder.py", line 331, in visit_callfunc
    if node.starargs is not None:
AttributeError: 'Call' object has no attribute 'starargs'

It seems reasonable to use python2.7 for such a job
of a stable branch.

support range of cores to convert to mask.
Closes-Bug: #1854341

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-01 10:42:37.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean port rules if port not found in ovsdb

During e.g. migration or shelve of VM it may happend that
port update event will be send to the ovs agent and in the almost
the same time, port will be removed from br-int.
In such case during update_port_filter method openvswitch firewall
driver will not find port in br-int, and it will do nothing with it.
That will lead to leftover rules for this port in br-int.

So this patch adds calling remove_port_filter() method if port was
not found in br-int. Just to be sure that there is no any leftovers
from the port in br-int anymore.

Change-Id: I06036ce5fe15d91aa440dc340a70dd27ae078c53
Closes-Bug: #1850557
'}, {'created': '2019-12-02 11:23:03.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean port rules if port not found in ovsdb

During e.g. migration or shelve of VM it may happend that
port update event will be send to the ovs agent and in the almost
the same time, port will be removed from br-int.
In such case during update_port_filter method openvswitch firewall
driver will not find port in br-int, and it will do nothing with it.
That will lead to leftover rules for this port in br-int.

So this patch adds calling remove_port_filter() method if port was
not found in br-int. Just to be sure that there is no any leftovers
from the port in br-int anymore.

Change-Id: I06036ce5fe15d91aa440dc340a70dd27ae078c53
Closes-Bug: #1850557
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Clean port rules if port not found in ovsdb

During e.g. migration or shelve of VM it may happend that
port update event will be send to the ovs agent and in the almost
the same time, port will be removed from br-int.
In such case during update_port_filter method openvswitch firewall
driver will not find port in br-int, and it will do nothing with it.
That will lead to leftover rules for this port in br-int.

So this patch adds calling remove_port_filter() method if port was
not found in br-int. Just to be sure that there is no any leftovers
from the port in br-int anymore.

Change-Id: I06036ce5fe15d91aa440dc340a70dd27ae078c53
Closes-Bug: #1850557

commit_message:
Delete Octavia configuration leftovers

Post update and upgrade tasks added in Change-Id
I32524f85ef6a0ca3e87fa9acc8c9e12776225717 do not run as expected.
Octavia is an external deploy. Best way to handle config leftover files
is with an Ansible task in the end of the external deploy.

Closes-Bug: #1836074
Change-Id: I72e2c75ae19c6f41f2938cf165b598345b3796fc

commit_message:
Change ec2 URLs to v3

This change modifies any URLs specifying v2.0 to v3. This is part
of the effort to remove v2.0 functionality from keystonemiddleware.

Change-Id: I9cde8963333ea95b4ab05d9aea4d196ab4357763
Partial-Bug: #1829453
Partial-Bug: #1845539

Remove v2.0 functionality

This change removes v2.0 functionality from
keystonemiddleware, as well as associated tests.

Partial-Bug: #1845539
Partial-Bug: #1777177

subject: Set ARQ get_all return 423 when any ARQ for vm is not resolved
messages:
[{'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-28 07:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-11-28 08:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, Sundar, I am not clear about the http 423 status for the arq request, could you please explain this?'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-28 10:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-28 10:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-11-28 23:37:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Hi, Sundar, I am not clear about the http 423 status for the arq
 > request, could you please explain this?

A caller may query Cyborg for all ARQs in 'resolved state', i.e. either successfully bound or failed to bind. If one or more ARQs is still going through binding, Cyborg returns HTTP 423, meaning the resource is currently 'locked' [1].

[1] https://www.restapitutorial.com/httpstatuscodes.html"}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-11-29 05:23:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Hi, Sundar, I am not clear about the http 423 status for the arq
 > > request, could you please explain this?
 > 
 > A caller may query Cyborg for all ARQs in 'resolved state', i.e.
 > either successfully bound or failed to bind. If one or more ARQs is
 > still going through binding, Cyborg returns HTTP 423, meaning the
 > resource is currently 'locked' [1].
 > 
 > [1] https://www.restapitutorial.com/httpstatuscodes.html

I am not sure this is the normal solution about waiting for the resolved state using 423 return code, If nova call this api and cyborg return 423 what should nova process the result?
I think the normal solution is return the instance all arqs, nova code handle a loop waiting all the arq resolved."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-11-29 06:05:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I think the normal solution is return the instance all arqs, nova
 > code handle a loop waiting all the arq resolved.

Polling from Nova was explicitly rejected in Train PTG. Cyborg should notify Nova when it is done. I gave a brief history and current status of Nova interaction in [1].

Basically, when Nova queries for ARQs, it is only interested in getting the ARQs if they are all done. Otherwise, it will wait for the notification and then query again. At least, that's the current solution we are exploring.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-cyborg/%23openstack-cyborg.2019-11-28.log.html#t2019-11-28T03:48:12"}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-11-29 06:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I think the normal solution is return the instance all arqs, nova
 > > code handle a loop waiting all the arq resolved.
 > 
 > Polling from Nova was explicitly rejected in Train PTG. Cyborg
 > should notify Nova when it is done. I gave a brief history and
 > current status of Nova interaction in [1].
 > 
 > Basically, when Nova queries for ARQs, it is only interested in
 > getting the ARQs if they are all done. Otherwise, it will wait for
 > the notification and then query again. At least, that's the current
 > solution we are exploring.
 > 
 > [1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-cyborg/%23openstack-cyborg.2019-11-28.log.html#t2019-11-28T03:48:12

Ohh, OK, Thanks for you clarification"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-11-29 08:34:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I should clarify that this is the behavior only if 'bind_state=resolved' is a query parameter for GET /v2/accelerator_requests. One could use:

* GET /v2/accelerator_requests -- to get all ARQs from Cyborg in any state.

* GET /v2/accelerator_requests?instance=uuid -- to get all ARQs for a specific instance.

* GET /v2/accelerator_requests?instance=uuid&bind_state=resolved -- this is the form used by Nova"}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-29 08:46:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I should clarify that this is the behavior only if
 > 'bind_state=resolved' is a query parameter for GET
 > /v2/accelerator_requests. One could use:
 > 
 > * GET /v2/accelerator_requests -- to get all ARQs from Cyborg in
 > any state.
 > 
 > * GET /v2/accelerator_requests?instance=uuid -- to get all ARQs for
 > a specific instance.
 > 
 > * GET /v2/accelerator_requests?instance=uuid&bind_state=resolved --
 > this is the form used by Nova

Agree."}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-30 03:51:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I should clarify that this is the behavior only if
 > 'bind_state=resolved' is a query parameter for GET
 > /v2/accelerator_requests. One could use:
 > 
 > * GET /v2/accelerator_requests -- to get all ARQs from Cyborg in
 > any state.
 > 
 > * GET /v2/accelerator_requests?instance=uuid -- to get all ARQs for
 > a specific instance.
 > 
 > * GET /v2/accelerator_requests?instance=uuid&bind_state=resolved --
 > this is the form used by Nova

agree. I will update arq doc based on this clarification.

And moreover, since we import query parameter bind_state=resolved, one could think a caller may query Cyborg for all ARQs in 'resolved state'(maybe not nova but other cyborg users). Please help to review https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696089/2"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-02 20:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for taking care to add UT as well.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-12-03 01:33:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-12-03 02:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-12-03 02:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-12-03 02:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-12-03 05:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-03 07:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27458, 'date': '2019-12-03 07:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-28 07:59:03.000000000', 'message': '(WIP)Set ARQ get_all return 423 when any ARQ for vm is not resolved

When nova or some user call ARQ get_all with url:
accelerator/v2/accelerator_requests?instance=f0fbe76c-1923-4758-ae54-e57631c98711&bind_state=resolved

If any ARQ for this instance is not resolved, the return code should
be 423(Locked) which will alert the user that the current arq is
being operated.

Change-Id: If95d39e5c326d70e17a9649bd281514e2ccf9abe

commit_message:
Set ARQ get_all return 423 when any ARQ for vm is not resolved

When nova or some user call ARQ get_all with url like:
accelerator/v2/accelerator_requests?instance=f0fbe76c-1923-4758-ae54-e57631c98711&bind_state=resolved

If any ARQ for this instance is not resolved, the return code should
be 423(Locked) which will alert the user that the current arq is
being operated.

Change-Id: If95d39e5c326d70e17a9649bd281514e2ccf9abe

commit_message:
ovn_dbs upgrade-with-os work

This adds the missing steps for the upgrades-with-os blueprint for
the ovn_dbs service. The ovn_dbs pacemaker service was not taken care of
in the initial work in https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/cb8caaae4381e6a3de81a517dc7c6b23d272e024
This commit tries to fix that.

Closes-Bug: #1854519

Tested-by: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I7bff96c0b0238e4aeaa33e0ec343a75e08b6a2f7
Change-Id: Id90754ad2506ee52d2a2cb939ccbf2d84e792cff

commit_message:
ovn_dbs override support

These hiera keys are needed to support the upgrade-with-os
blueprint. This support was added for other services already
see LP#1832361

Related-Bug: #1854519

Tested-by: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7bff96c0b0238e4aeaa33e0ec343a75e08b6a2f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 02:46:05.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in os-services, lock policies

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

There are two type of scope:
1. 'system': policy with 'system' scope means user with
'system-scoped' token have permission to access otherwise not.
This scope type can be applied to API policies which need
access permission at system level for example os-hypervisiors,
os-services etc. By adding scope_type as 'system' to API policy
means project-level scoped token cannot access these API.

2. 'project': policy with 'project' scope means user with
'project-scoped' token have permission to access.
This scope type can be applied to API policies which need
access permission at project level for example GET /servers.

Any policy need permission for both scope 'system' and 'project'
can be added with both scope, for example: scope_type['system', 'project']

Partial implement blueprint policy-default-refresh

Change-Id: I999f8d84e10ff1a57c1ff6b717801b495032e358

commit_message:
Add new default rules and mapping in policy base class

We are introducing new default roles with scope capability
in policies. To reuse those new default check_str or rules
among policies, default rules have been defined in base class.

Also adding the mapping of new default roles, rules with
legacy role, rules.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I999f8d84e10ff1a57c1ff6b717801b495032e358

subject: snat can not be disabled while router update
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 11:26:43.000000000', 'message': 'snat can not be disabled while router update

router snat can not be disabled while invoking router rest API to update
snat flag from true to false, Ovn is still forwarding external traffic

Change-Id: I604e2f515ace0ade2888fe700eb4264e72ba9eb9
Closes-Bug: #1853829
'}]
commit_message:
snat can not be disabled while router update

router snat can not be disabled while invoking router rest API to update
snat flag from true to false, Ovn is still forwarding external traffic

Change-Id: I604e2f515ace0ade2888fe700eb4264e72ba9eb9
Closes-Bug: #1853829

commit_message:
Fix syntax error in installation guide

This fixes a missing comma in the configuration example
and also adds a proper default key to caches.

Change-Id: I907172cfe295b310617139b0431ededda7fc33f4

[{'created': '2019-12-02 20:14:06.000000000', 'message': 'api-guide: flesh out the server actions section

The API guide on faults has a section on server actions
but just links to the API reference. There is also the
"Asynchronous faults" section at the bottom which refers
to the server actions API but does not go into details.

This fleshes that section on server actions out a bit more
and includes a walkthrough on the command line of a failed
resize due to NoValidHost. I chose this example since the
server status does not change to ERROR so there is no fault
to see in the server details when the resize action fails.

Change-Id: I95130eeeac1ef8f4676925fe6c0e2d386d88259c
'}]
commit_message:
api-guide: flesh out the server actions section

The API guide on faults has a section on server actions
but just links to the API reference. There is also the
"Asynchronous faults" section at the bottom which refers
to the server actions API but does not go into details.

This fleshes that section on server actions out a bit more
and includes a walkthrough on the command line of a failed
resize due to NoValidHost. I chose this example since the
server status does not change to ERROR so there is no fault
to see in the server details when the resize action fails.

Change-Id: I95130eeeac1ef8f4676925fe6c0e2d386d88259c

[{'created': '2019-11-27 16:46:25.000000000', 'message': "Process requested_resources in ResourceRequest init

Previously, resources_from_request_spec was initializing ResourceRequest
and then tacking on the RequestSpec.resource_requests. This made little
sense in light of the fact that ResourceRequest init's job is processing
the RequestSpec.

To make the flow more scrutable, this commit integrates the processing
of RequestSpec.requested_resources into ResourceRequest.__init__.

As a result, ResourceRequest.add_request_group() is no longer used
outside of ResourceRequest itself, so it is made private.

No test changes are necessary with this refactor. All the flows that
were previously calling ResourceRequest.__init__ directly were either
doing so with a RequestSpec with no resource_requests, or were ignoring
the resource_requests in ways that didn't matter (at least not yet). The
latter had two cases:

- isolate_aggregates. Theoretically if you had tried to isolate
  aggregates based on traits fed in through port bandwidth requests,
  those traits would have been ignored.
- Selecting hosts with specific CPU model flags (libvirt only).
  Theoretically your bandwidth request could have required certain CPU
  flag-based traits and they would have been ignored.

Change-Id: Ibb0ee191c76df0d34c83daf97f462380e2741c94
"}, {'created': '2019-12-02 13:28:06.000000000', 'message': "Process requested_resources in ResourceRequest init

Change-Id: Ibb0ee191c76df0d34c83daf97f462380e2741c94

commit_message:
Process requested_resources in ResourceRequest init

Previously, resources_from_request_spec was initializing ResourceRequest
and then tacking on the RequestSpec.resource_requests. This made little
sense in light of the fact that ResourceRequest init's job is processing
the RequestSpec.

To make the flow more scrutable, this commit integrates the processing
of RequestSpec.requested_resources into ResourceRequest.__init__.

As a result, ResourceRequest.add_request_group() is no longer used
outside of ResourceRequest itself, so it is made private.

No test changes are necessary with this refactor. All the flows that
were previously calling ResourceRequest.__init__ directly were either
doing so with a RequestSpec with no resource_requests, or were ignoring
the resource_requests in ways that didn't matter (at least not yet). The
latter had two cases:

- isolate_aggregates. Theoretically if you had tried to isolate
  aggregates based on traits fed in through port bandwidth requests,
  those traits would have been ignored.
- Selecting hosts with specific CPU model flags (libvirt only).
  Theoretically your bandwidth request could have required certain CPU
  flag-based traits and they would have been ignored.

Change-Id: Ibb0ee191c76df0d34c83daf97f462380e2741c94

This looks great. My only ask is that we change the sub-flow names to not conflict with the parent/other flow names.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-07-11 20:51:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

(3 comments)

Actually, this has more issues:
http://logs.openstack.org/91/662791/13/check/octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-amphora-v2/2499883/controller/logs/screen-o-cw.txt.gz#_Jun_18_12_40_59_773645
Is there a way we can not log these as ERRORs?
Really I don't think this should be reverting, maybe a revert method on a task needs to be updated?"}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-12 13:01:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

(7 comments)

I was looking to how not to trace all of that as error, but didn't find how. As it is throwing an exception and then it is retried the task... May be taskflow should be expanded for such cases.

Actually the description of RETRY is
``RETRY``: when the controlling flow must be reverted and restarted again  https://github.com/openstack/taskflow/blob/master/taskflow/retry.py#L219
So, it is expected that it is shown as reverted and then restarted.
There is no option without revert to do retry..."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-12 13:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-07-26 11:39:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Workflow-1

The problem that I described in inline comment now I can describe as a blocker for using taskflow retry mechanism and using Redis backend as a result.

I filed a bug for taskflow about this issue https://bugs.launchpad.net/taskflow/+bug/1838015

I will mark this change as WIP for now and will continue development using zookeper backend. On the next team meeting will discuss this issue more.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-08-08 08:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-08-08 10:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-08-08 13:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-08-08 13:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-08-08 15:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

This change is not blocked from review and merging now, as issue was fixed on the taskflow side.
As currently we do not store any tasks details it is safe to merge as it is. Newer taskflow version will be required for persistence enablement in upcoming changes.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-09-12 10:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-09-18 14:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Patch Set 17 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-10-17 10:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-10-22 09:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30619, 'date': '2019-10-23 05:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Use retry for AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait

Use taskflow retry for connectivity wait. [1]

This reqired for redis jobboard implementation as each retry expand
claim for job on worker. This means that worker is proccesing job and
it should not be released for other workers to work on it.

Adopted for v2 flows.

[1] - https://docs.openstack.org/taskflow/latest/user/atoms.html#retry

Story: 2005072
Task: 33477

Change-Id: I2cf241ea965ad56ed70ebde83632ab855f5d859e

commit_message:
Reusable RequestGroup.add_{resource|trait}

This simply refactors the (minimal) logic to add a resource or
(required/forbidden) trait to a RequestGroup into RequestGroup itself.
It didn't make sense for it to be in ResourceRequest.

This will make the logic reusable for e.g. assembling
RequestSpec.requested_resources for accelerator requests.

This is a straight refactor, thoroughly covered by existing tests.

Change-Id: Ied2047a6bd22d194b3c33dca44bf81e7eebc6c86

commit_message:
Rename overcloud-delete playbook

This change renames our workflow playbook to have the prefix
"cli-". This is being done so that we can easily identify
playbooks that are used in the client.

Change-Id: Ic0bd173ad34d1c01a58a66d9a754acd3093a972c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix samples with dots in sample name

This patch fixes Prometheus publisher behavior when Ceilometer
metric names contain dots by replacing them with underscores.
Prometheus does not accept metrics with dots.

Change-Id: If4799a1b17001c0535413a26ec5d2f427e52f168
Signed-off-by: Yanos Angelopoulos <yanos@admin.grnet.gr>

Fix samples with dots in sample name

This patch fixes Prometheus publisher behavior when Ceilometer
metric names contain dots by replacing them with underscores.
Prometheus does not accept metrics with dots.

Signed-off-by: Yanos Angelopoulos <yanos@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
Support hidden vnc console server header

This commit aims to add a config option to assert the contents
of vnc server HTTP response headers better than before.

Before vnc tests would always assume there is a server header in
the vnc server HTTP response headers.

After this change, vnc tests will now only check the server name
if the config option for ``vnc_server_header_included`` is set to
True and will assert the server header is not in the vnc server
HTTP response if it is set to False.

Change-Id: I918cc5cde3af6ff34c1db4a588991e999b23d6e1

commit_message:
Fix API breakage due to new exceptions module

The commit ae244fcf25188f38c28870238e648e765a2e3adf broke API consumers
by moving the OctaviaClientException to a different module. Ensure it
remains available in its previous location by importing it by name.

Change-Id: I35aa0bf105c3b59abb2ff775af12198bc0436572
Story: #2006970
Task: 37698

commit_message:
Use 2048-bits keys for devstack certificates

RHEL8 and Centos8 refuse to load certificates generated with a 1024-bits
key because of new security policies. Increasing key size to 2048-bits
fixes certificate generation scripts for these distributions.

Story 2006944
Task 37623

Change-Id: I6d5d39c4cf87ac687355f80ca591c1a611f46f41

Implement Security Context for Nova

Implement container security context for the following Nova resources:
 - Nova server deployment

commit_message:
Add devstack job to .zuul.conf

We know we want to have some level of functional testing to verify
enforcement models. This commit uses one approach to add a base
devstack job to oslo.limit's .zuul.conf so that we have a minimal-ish
installation to configure with limits and write actual integration and
functional tests against.

Change-Id: I50c41805b8e196fdaf20c95e9aa687b98c369a57

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 05:26:06.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we add all_nodes_extra_map_data to all_nodes

Refactor of `overcloud cell export` in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694115/
fixed the filtered AllNodesConfig to be exported as
AllNodesExtraMapData. Now when all_nodes_extra_map_data includes
information for services which are not enabled on the cell controllers
the information is still required to point to the correct endpoint.
This make sure we add all the information from all_nodes_extra_map_data
to the hieradata in case of nova_additional_cell.

Also this change addes Prefer redis_vip from all_nodes_extra_map_data.
When all_nodes_extra_map_data includes a value for redis_vip that
value should be preferred over any other.

Closes-Bug: #1853472

Change-Id: Ib0016d0e0139d336dd9c8afe5fe9b10bb0cf0124
(cherry picked from commit 7385d5e4c5d61db913e322c35da924e89b556ba8)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we add all_nodes_extra_map_data to all_nodes

Refactor of `overcloud cell export` in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694115/
fixed the filtered AllNodesConfig to be exported as
AllNodesExtraMapData. Now when all_nodes_extra_map_data includes
information for services which are not enabled on the cell controllers
the information is still required to point to the correct endpoint.
This make sure we add all the information from all_nodes_extra_map_data
to the hieradata in case of nova_additional_cell.

Also this change addes Prefer redis_vip from all_nodes_extra_map_data.
When all_nodes_extra_map_data includes a value for redis_vip that
value should be preferred over any other.

Closes-Bug: #1853472

Change-Id: Ib0016d0e0139d336dd9c8afe5fe9b10bb0cf0124
(cherry picked from commit 7385d5e4c5d61db913e322c35da924e89b556ba8)

commit_message:
Remove "mv" from rootwrap filter

Use oslo.privsep instead of oslo.rootwrap
to run the "mv" command.

Change-Id: I1433ab2aa6dac69929dbd76ab1e7448a0f2e116f
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

 > I wonder if https://review.opendev.org/#/c/570433/ is the "fix"
 > that allows this test to pass in rocky and newer, for queens we
 > could drop the 'routes' field in this other test, but this is
 > mostly a blind fix idea. Thoughts?

Bernard: I check it and it is not enough to solve the issue'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-11-26 08:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > sqlalchemy.orm.exc.DetachedInstanceError: Parent instance
 > > <BGPVPNPortAssociation at 0x7fab92a81090> is not bound to a
 > > Session; lazy load operation of attribute 'routes' cannot proceed
 > >
 > > I wonder if https://review.opendev.org/#/c/570433/ is the "fix"
 > > that allows this test to pass in rocky and newer, for queens we
 > > could drop the 'routes' field in this other test, but this is
 > > mostly a blind fix idea. Thoughts?
 > 
 > Bernard: I check it and it is not enough to solve the issue

As this is stable/queens I feel it is acceptable to remove this failing test. I understand that this is coverage degradation, but extended maintenance accepts the limited capacity of teams and it was said that it is acceptable that with time testing should decrease on these branches.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-11-26 13:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-11-27 08:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt and make unit tests pass

This is a combination of 2 commits to make check/gate jobs pass:

1. Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

(cherry picked from commit 3f1a317df0aa09c8f66dfc2f8487f79e43ae33aa)
(cherry picked from commit 2aaccf0da92169b705f149d9e91dc11d61dfd50a)
(cherry picked from commit a6037ee5e4acda4e330d0b92df5fabc75540ec68)

2. fix BGPVPN OVO unit test

The 'routes' field should not exist. This bug
was silent until now, but came to the light
after neutron change I42cdf540129bd4470ec1a59345db9845a6198328 .

Note: test_db_obj is skipped from BGPVPNPortAssociationTest class as
suggested.

3. Anchor pyton2.7 for pep8

For python3 at least pylint 1.9 is suggested, so let's try to run pep8
with python2.7 on stable/queens.

Related-Change: I42cdf540129bd4470ec1a59345db9845a6198328

Change-Id: Id3363068e2882dae63b835c178bf4770297a85b7
(cherry picked from commit d9ea5cf9dd01fe85eea3d8f501aec974231b7322)

I love this change!!  It's going to be a great performance improvement.

Please add a release note saying that the start up speed of the backup service has been greatly improved.  This is the only reason for the downvote, the code looks good to me otherwise.

It would be better if we had unit tests for the DB changes, though we don't currently have any test coverage for the `_process_backups_filters` method, so I won't downvote the patch for the missing tests."}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2019-11-12 14:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Speed up starting cinder-backup

When start/restart cinder-backup, we will get all backups from cinder
DB and then check the status in the for loop. It will take a long time
when the backups in a huge amount. Now we just get all incomplete
backups what we really need to do the job with.

Change-Id: I5c6065d99116ae5f223799e8558d25777aedd055

[{'created': '2019-10-08 17:56:27.000000000', 'message': "Stop testing python 2

Since it's no longer supported past Train, lets stop
running the tests.

py27 unittest tox target is kept because the job is defined
globally for all projects. We can remove the py27 tox target
once the job is removed.

Change-Id: Ia30435b3bb19acd1d2f9fe217251c393d4f7480e

Stop testing python 2

Since it's no longer supported past Train, lets stop
running the tests.

[{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-11-29 01:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-12-01 21:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Here is a clean ironic-inspector log:
http://logs.rdoproject.org/33/696633/1/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001/08cb5e0/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/ironic-inspector/ironic-inspector.log.txt.gz

And an haproxy log which logs GET /v1/introspection calls:
http://logs.rdoproject.org/33/696633/1/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001/08cb5e0/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/haproxy/haproxy.log.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-12-02 01:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 01:12:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove haproxy ironic-inspector http-check workaround

When werkzeug was used as the WSGI service for ironic-inspector, it
wrote stack traces to the logs whenever haproxy did a http check; this
listen_options line was the workaround for that. Reverting that change
is done for the following reasons:

- since ironic-inspector now uses oslo-service, the log stack traces
  are no longer written
- setting listen_options overrides the default 'option httplog', which is
  making diagnosing bug #1854399 harder
- this http-check override may well be the root cause of bug #1854399
  (any non-200 response will result in other connections to
  ironic-inspector being disconnected?)

Change-Id: I5c397d31650b248660a39e028c98c779871d07ba
Partial-Bug: #1854399
Related-Bug: #1691971
"}]
commit_message:
Remove haproxy ironic-inspector http-check workaround

When werkzeug was used as the WSGI service for ironic-inspector, it
wrote stack traces to the logs whenever haproxy did a http check; this
listen_options line was the workaround for that. Reverting that change
is done for the following reasons:

- since ironic-inspector now uses oslo-service, the log stack traces
  are no longer written
- setting listen_options overrides the default 'option httplog', which is
  making diagnosing bug #1854399 harder
- this http-check override may well be the root cause of bug #1854399
  (any non-200 response will result in other connections to
  ironic-inspector being disconnected?)

Change-Id: I5c397d31650b248660a39e028c98c779871d07ba
Partial-Bug: #1854399
Related-Bug: #1691971

commit_message:
Add meta to mistral

Mistral didn't get the meta/ information that is usually present
on all our roles.

This fixes it. I added mnaser and his company in meta, as he is
the original author of this role.
At the opposite of other roles, I didn't add the apt dependency.

Change-Id: Iba8ae5e8ded1398649792ecc5b4d9267551713c4

commit_message:
Add test to create policy with multiple rules

The test validates that:
1.Two bandwidth limit rules could be both attached to a policy.
2.The system prevents addition of rules with the same direction to a policy.

Change-Id: I387d50673795c2a5073ec298426960fca593c017

commit_message:
Add more condition to check sg member exist

Only check sg object is not enough, we should also
check sg'ports is {} or not. Otherwise the old conjunction
will still exist.

Change-Id: I10588e73a9da7fdd43677f9247c176811dd68c62
Closes-Bug: #1854131

commit_message:
refactor(deploy-k8s): remove explicit wait on etcd pod

Using `--network-plugin=cni` for `minikube start` will have minikube
wait for Kubernetes components to spin up and not require the Node to be
in ready status.

Change-Id: I08bf40ac4790955c107e8fee6a004b930c333d16

commit_message:
Replace netaddr dependency with stdlib ipaddress

netaddr is quite a big library, and all we need is covered by
the built-in ipaddress module (available in python 3).

Also add a safeguard for invalid 'ip route' output.

Change-Id: I9d76a8d1c1b6b1585e301a9c63b37fab3b98746f

commit_message:
Fix volumes and volume_snapshots integration tests

The aim of this PS is to fix existing skipped integration
tests related to volumes and volume_snapshots listed below:
  - TestAdminVolumes.test_volume_create_edit_delete
  - TestVolumesActions.test_volume_extend
  - TestVolumesBasic.test_volume_create_edit_delete
  - TestAdminVolumes.test_volumes_pagination
  - TestVolumesBasic.test_volumes_pagination
  - TestVolumeSnapshotsAdmin.test_create_edit_delete_volume_snapshot
  - TestVolumeSnapshotsBasic.test_create_edit_delete_volume_snapshot
  - TestVolumeSnapshotsAdmin.test_volume_snapshots_pagination
  - TestVolumeSnapshotsAdvanced.test_create_volume_from_snapshot
  - TestVolumeSnapshotsBasic.test_volume_snapshots_pagination

This PS also resolves Partial-Bug: #1792028

Change-Id: I31a8d681f87d22ce8486de38ba6c01be9c9cc469

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-10 14:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Two things:

1. Can we sort out the various bugs I've mentioned to see which ones this fixes and then duplicate whatever is a duplicate and decide on one (probably the oldest) bug for the same issue.

2. I don't trust unit tests for this type of stuff since it involves (a) more than one service and (b) the database. Can we write a functional test to recreate the bug and then assert the fix resolves it?"}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-10-10 14:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Can we write a functional test to recreate the bug and then assert the fix resolves it?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

That said, this is so simple I'm not sure it's worth it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I didn't -1 for the lack of a functional test, but if I were doing this it's what I'd do which is why I asked for it but I'm not forcing it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Oh heh nevermind.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:34:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

After discussing this more in IRC, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693537/ is the fix for this bug that is more likely to actually work, because the bdm is the last thing created in the compute method and if we timed out before getting to that we still orphan the BDM.

The problem with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693537/ and backports (Red Hat is targeting queens for this fix https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1752734) is that long_rpc_timeout is not in queens, it was introduced to nova in rocky.

So I'm a bit hesitant to land this and backport it when I don't know that it will actually solve anything since using long_rpc_timeout is thing that will likely resolve this. And the better long-term fix is creating the BDM in the API and passing it down which is my WIP here:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692940/

But someone might need to take that over since I'm not working on it really."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-02 15:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Another option for stable branches is adding a [workaround] option that is only used for the reserve_block_device_name call which overrides the default rpc_response_timeout. If you did that, I'd probably make the workaround option default to None to mean "use the value from rpc_response_timeout by default for backward compat" but if set then it would override rpc_response_timeout for that one call, and the workaround option would go away once long_rpc_timeout is being used (Ussuri).'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-02 20:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-02 20:08:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> After discussing this more in IRC, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693537/
 > is the fix for this bug that is more likely to actually work,
 > because the bdm is the last thing created in the compute method and
 > if we timed out before getting to that we still orphan the BDM.
 > 
 > The problem with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693537/ and
 > backports (Red Hat is targeting queens for this fix
 > https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1752734) is that
 > long_rpc_timeout is not in queens, it was introduced to nova in
 > rocky.
 > 
 > So I'm a bit hesitant to land this and backport it when I don't
 > know that it will actually solve anything since using
 > long_rpc_timeout is thing that will likely resolve this. 

Yeah understood, I'm going to close this out and focus on the long_rpc_timeout backports to Rocky and possible workaround option in Queens.

 > And the better long-term fix is creating the BDM in the API and passing it
 > down which is my WIP here:
 > 
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692940/
 > 
 > But someone might need to take that over since I'm not working on
 > it really.

ACK happy to move this forward if you don't have time."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-12-02 20:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
compute: Remove stale BDMs on reserve_block_device_name failure

Previously errors encountered when creating BDMs on a remote compute
host via reserve_block_device_name could result in stale BDM entries
being left in the database.

This change adds some simple cleanup logic to reserve_block_device_name
to lookup and remove any such BDMs when an exception is encountered
before reraising.

Related-Bug: #1844296
Change-Id: I3c45b3e9c8a5a9ce1e0e47abb8f95089f8c212c3

subject: Reduce severity of wrapped exceptions logs to warning
messages:
[{'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2019-11-08 08:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-11-08 14:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

these log.exception calls show the stack trace for the underlying SQLAlchemy / driver error raise before it is wrapped.    if only client libraries should log errors then simply disable oslo.db logging.'}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2019-11-11 12:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> these log.exception calls show the stack trace for the underlying
 > SQLAlchemy / driver error raise before it is wrapped.    if only
 > client libraries should log errors then simply disable oslo.db
 > logging.

Could their severity be reduced to warning or debug?
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/log-guidelines.html#stacktraces-in-logs'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-11-11 14:24:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

can you specify what the problem you're having is?"}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2019-11-11 14:38:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> can you specify what the problem you're having is?

Sure. Customer sometimes sees stacktraces from here in their neutron server logs - see attached to https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.db/+bug/1851797 . Because it's logged as an error they believe it's serious and needs to be addressed. But neutron caught and retried the transaction successfully and there is no real problem for them to deal with."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-11-11 14:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I can remove these logs if we can confirm that under Python 3, a full raise + log by a single log.exception() will indicate the full wrapped lineage of the error, that's the part I don't want to be lost.   I dont want a thrown exception in the logs to dead-end at oslo.db.DBError without further information.   I haven't looked at how we do the wrapping here in awhile but we should be setting up the "__cause__" under Python 3. if we are doing that correctly then we can remove these.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-11-11 15:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

actually neutrons' issue resolution at https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f21eed3998a793f5c40eb248469dc4245de3415a indicates they did not solve this error in the way I would prefer, as they are duplicating logic that should be here by doing "_is_nested_instance(e, db_exc.DBError) and '1305' in str(e)".   This is database-specific hardcoding that should all be taking place here, not in Neutron.

This condition should be caught by oslo.db and neutron should not be parsing error messages in a database-specific way.    Just for reference the SQLAlchemy-level discussion is now seen at https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/2696 where I mention that in Python 3 we can get the "__cause__" automatically, but in any case, oslo.db should be throwing DBDeadlock at least in the python 3 case where it can analyze the "cause" to see this is the case.   The log line here should likely be at "warning" level as it alerts us to an error case that is not handled by any of the built-in cases; if the downstream app is handling and retrying on a raw DBError, that's a bug.   

as far as if we can throw DBDeadlock in Python 2 where there is no `__cause__`, I would say probably not.  Neutron's str() logic should be considered a Python 2 artifact and oslo.db should catch the "SAVEPOINT" error here using a special rule that looks up `__cause__` so that it can ultimately raise DBDeadlock.'}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2019-11-11 17:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Okay thanks. This is a way more complicated than I first thought. I simply assumed neutron would be able to log the complete stacktrace if it failed after max retries.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-11-11 18:12:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK maybe I made it sound complicated because I was thinking on the fly.

1. these can be warnings, that's this gerrit.  which is all you asked for.

2. oslo.db should have an additional rule added to catch the SAVEPOINT condition, which when intercepted, tries to look at __cause__ and confirm this is in fact a deadlock.  (hard part: adding tests).   should be a separate gerrit 

3. neutron under python 3 at least would no longer need the str() check they are doing.  (hard part: testing as this is likely difficult to reproduce, mock test might be sufficient).


if you just do #1, I'd be sad that #2 and #3 need to find a resource, but I won't block merging #1 alone."}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2019-11-13 11:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-11-13 18:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2019-11-14 02:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-02 18:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Client libraries should decide if they need to be logged.

Change-Id: I6ea68fb17ceac23337bfb7405eb3f7a6df8b61f2
Closes-Bug: 1851797
"}, {'created': '2019-11-13 11:46:50.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce severity of wrapped exceptions logs to warning

Change-Id: I6ea68fb17ceac23337bfb7405eb3f7a6df8b61f2

'}]

[{'created': '2019-12-02 01:06:10.000000000', 'message': "fix indenting of reproducer job

Currently the following is rendered:

      remove_ovb_after_job: false
      mirror_fqdn: mirror.regionone.rdo-cloud.rdoproject.org
                  registry_login_enabled: false
      featureset_override:

The extra whitespace before registry_login_enabled resulted in the job
stopping immediately with the following being logged to the zuul
scheduler:

  2019-12-01 23:03:41,937 - zuul.Pipeline.tripleo-ci-reproducer.check - DEBUG - [e: 0fc90aaf41e24e88b9db295d2e14d481] <QueueItem 0x7fcefecf5240 for <Change 0x7fcf00cc1eb8 test
1 1001,1> in check> is a failing item because ['it has an invalid configuration']

The indented conditional blocks must be adding whitespace, this
approach might need to be reconsidered to make this more robust.

Change-Id: I01d6b312cc1ecb418faf1ce3bc4098b7600359ca
"}]
commit_message:
fix indenting of reproducer job

Currently the following is rendered:

      remove_ovb_after_job: false
      mirror_fqdn: mirror.regionone.rdo-cloud.rdoproject.org
                  registry_login_enabled: false
      featureset_override:

The extra whitespace before registry_login_enabled resulted in the job
stopping immediately with the following being logged to the zuul
scheduler:

  2019-12-01 23:03:41,937 - zuul.Pipeline.tripleo-ci-reproducer.check - DEBUG - [e: 0fc90aaf41e24e88b9db295d2e14d481] <QueueItem 0x7fcefecf5240 for <Change 0x7fcf00cc1eb8 test
1 1001,1> in check> is a failing item because ['it has an invalid configuration']

The indented conditional blocks must be adding whitespace, this
approach might need to be reconsidered to make this more robust.

Change-Id: I01d6b312cc1ecb418faf1ce3bc4098b7600359ca

commit_message:
Component promotion jobs should read a custom release cfg

Change the logic to load a custom release config file for
component promotion jobs. In the job definition it must be defined
w/ 'component_promotion' var e.g.:
vars:
  component_promotion: compute

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1408

Change-Id: Ib34d543a7307c8b930f93a1dd7359ebb5593ebea

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I2c9f7b72a52edde7b18dc66bcc8c655630b3bbc2
